rain.description: Returns the current value of rain density.

rank.title: rank
rank.description:
Returns the rank of the given unit. Rank can be one of the following:
* `"PRIVATE"`
* `"CORPORAL"`
* `"SERGEANT"`
* `"LIEUTENANT"`
* `"CAPTAIN"`
* `"MAJOR"`
* `"COLONEL"`

reload.title: reload
reload.description:
Main syntax: Reload first found muzzle that needs reloading (with some inconsistencies).
Alternative syntax: this syntax allows to reload given muzzle with given magazine while playing proper animation.
If param is omitted or is empty string, default value is used. The default behaviour is to find the best matching magazine for the provided muzzle from the pool of available magazines.
If specific magazine is requested, the reload will fail if unit has run out of this type of magazines. If an empty array  inline[] is given, the behaviour is similar to pressing the "Reload" key.
The command reloads the given muzzle but does not select it. In case of throwable muzzles, each throwable has its own muzzle, they are autoreloaded after throw.
Using reload on the throwable muzzle will just swap throwable for another one of the same type from inventory.

args.name: muzzle
args.desc: (Optional, default currentMuzzle) muzzle name or "" for the current muzzle.

args.name: magazine
args.desc: (Optional, default given muzzle magazine) magazine name or "" for given muzzle's magazine. If given muzzle is currentMuzzle then currentMagazine

reloadenabled.title: reloadEnabled
reloadenabled.description: Check whether magazine is reloaded whenever emptied.

removeswitchableunit.title: removeSwitchableUnit
removeswitchableunit.description: Remove a unit from the list of units available for Team Switch.

posscreentoworld.title: posScreenToWorld
posscreentoworld.description: Converts map screen coordinates into world coordinates. Unlike ctrlMapScreenToWorld, this command returns world position is format [x, y, 0], otherwise it is identical to it.

posworldtoscreen.title: posWorldToScreen
posworldtoscreen.description: Converts world coordinates into map screen coordinates. This command is identical to ctrlMapWorldToScreen.

args.name: position : Array - world position in format Position2D or Position3D

precision.title: precision
precision.description: Return the movement precision of the given entity, how is the entity able to be precise when moving to given target.

overcast.title: overcast
overcast.description: Return the current overcast level. Zero is clear skies, one is maximum cloud cover.

needreload.title: needReload
needreload.description: Returns how much vehicle wants to reload its weapons.

nextweatherchange.title: nextWeatherChange
nextweatherchange.description:
Return the remaining time (in seconds) over which the current weather change will occur.

When a weather change finishes, the game engine will automatically generate a new random weather change over a realistic time period (minimum of 90 minutes).

nearobjects.title: nearObjects
nearobjects.description: Find objects (Units, Vehicles, Dead, Map Objects) in a sphere with given radius. The first object in the returned array is not necessarily the closest one. If you need returned objects to be sorted by distance, use nearestObjects. If typeName is given, only objects of given type (or its subtype) are listed.

args.name: position: Array format PositionAGL, Position2D or Object

max.title: max
max.description: The greater value of a and b.

min.title: min
min.description: The smaller of a and b.

missionconfigfile.title: missionConfigFile
missionconfigfile.description: Return root of mission Description.ext entries hierarchy.

modeltoworld.title: modelToWorld
modeltoworld.description:
Translates relative position from object model space to world space in PositionAGL format.
This command will take into account vectorUp of the object when calculating relative coordinates.
For the PositionASL version of this command, see modelToWorldWorld.

args.name: position: Array format PositionRelative - [x,y,z] offset relative to the model centre

moveinturret.title: moveInTurret
moveinturret.description: Moves the soldier into the vehicle's turret. (Immediately, without animation).

movetofailed.title: moveToFailed
movetofailed.description: Check if latest low level moveTo command failed.

limitspeed.title: limitSpeed
limitspeed.description: Limit the speed of an AI-driven vehicle or AI person to given value. It has continuous effect and AI will not break through the speed limitation until one is contacted, engaged or regrouped.

args.name: speed
args.desc: in km/h; set to `-1` (or any <= 0 value) to remove the limit

kbadddatabase.title: kbAddDatabase
kbadddatabase.description: Register knowledge base database to given person. See Conversations for more details.

kbadddatabasetargets.title: kbAddDatabaseTargets
kbadddatabasetargets.description: Register target list knowledge base database to given person. See Conversations for more details.

kbaddtopic.title: kbAddTopic
kbaddtopic.description: Register conversation topic to given person. See Conversations for more details.

args.name: topicName
args.desc: the topic id for further reference

args.name:
fsmFile: String - (Optional) .fsm file path. Receives the following parameters:
* _sentenceId: the sentence as defined in the .bikb file
* _topic: TopicName registered via kbAddTopic
* _this: the person that was talked to (receiver)
* _from: the person that talked to the receiver and triggered the script

eventHandler: Code or String - (Optional) code to execute - given String will be compiled. This is not an sqf file path.
Parameters: identical to fsmFile - see above.

kbtell.title: kbTell
kbtell.description: Make the person tell to the receiver the sentence. See Conversations for more details.

syntaxes.code: person kbTell [receiver, topicName, sentenceClass, argumentArray1, argumentArray2, ..., forceRadio]

args.name:
argumentArrayN: Array - (Optional) format [argumentName, argumentValue, argumentText, argumentSpeech]:
* argumentName: String
* argumentValue: Code
* argumentText: String
* argumentSpeech: Array of Strings - each string is an already defined word in config.

forceRadio: Boolean, Number or String (last value of the array) - (Optional)
* Boolean true/false to force use of radio
* Number 1-10 to force use of custom radio channel
* String name of radio channel to use, from: 'GLOBAL', 'SIDE', 'GROUP', 'VEHICLE', 'DIRECT', 'COMMAND'

lbselection.title: lbSelection
lbselection.description: Returns Array of selected rows indices in the given listbox. If listbox is of style LB_MULTI (multi-selection) the array will contain multiple elements, otherwise only a single element. For single selection listbox one can also use lbCurSel. See also lbIsSelected, lbSetSelected

lbsetselected.title: lbSetSelected
lbsetselected.description:
Sets the selection state of the given row of the given listbox of style LB_MULTI.
The command has to be called for every row which is needed to be selected in multi-selection listbox. Use negative index -1 to select/deselect all rows (since ).
For single selection listbox use lbSetCurSel instead.

args.name: index: Number or since  Array of Numbers
forceEH
args.desc: (Optional, default false) will force  lbSelChanged EH to fire

kbhastopic.title: kbHasTopic
kbhastopic.description: Check if conversation topic was registered to given person. See Conversations for more details.

round.title: round
round.description: Rounds the provided value to the closest integer.

image.title: image
image.description: Creates a structured text containing the given image. Use setAttributes to set additional  attributes on the image.

ingameuiseteventhandler.title: inGameUISetEventHandler
ingameuiseteventhandler.description:
Sets given event handler of in-game UI. If EH function returns true, performed action is overridden. Event handlers available are:
* "PrevAction" - mouse scroll up
* "Action" - action key press
* "NextAction" - mouse scroll down
In order to remove a previously added event handler, set it again with an empty code string `""`.

inheritsfrom.title: inheritsFrom
inheritsfrom.description: Returns base entry of config entry.

initambientlife.title: initAmbientLife
initambientlife.description: Initialises the ambient life on local client from `CfgWorlds >> worldName >> AmbientA3`. Has no effect on dedicated server or headless client.

ishidden.title: isHidden
ishidden.description: Returns whether a person is hidden (reached the hiding position).

ishidebehindscripted.title: isHideBehindScripted
ishidebehindscripted.description: Return whether the vehicle has set the hideBehindScripted to true or not.

istext.title: isText
istext.description: Checks if config entry represents a text value.

isplayer.title: isPlayer
isplayer.description: Checks if given person is a player. Returns true for headless clients as well.

returns.desc: true if is/was player and the identity still exists on the (dead) body

isnumber.title: isNumber
isnumber.description: Check if config entry represents number.

isformationleader.title: isFormationLeader
isformationleader.description: Returns true if the specified unit is subgroup leader.

returns.desc: true if unit is subgroup leader.

htmlload.title: htmlLoad
htmlload.description:
Load HTML from file or URI using given control. File path is relative to current mission dir or an absolute path (with drive letter etc.).
The command is subject to restrictions, imposed by CfgCommands class.

args.name: filename
args.desc: local file name or remote file URL

hierarchyobjectscount.title: hierarchyObjectsCount
hierarchyobjectscount.description: The number of objects in hierarchy.

hidebehindscripted.title: hideBehindScripted
hidebehindscripted.description: When set to true it disables the default engine hiding behavior.

getvariable.title: getVariable
getvariable.description:
Returns the value of variable in the variable space assigned to various data types.
All available data types combinations:
{! classwikitable
!colspan2Primary syntax (String) !! colspan2Alternative syntax (Array)
!-
!Code
!Since
!Code
!Since
!-
! Namespace getVariable String !! - !! Namespace getVariable Array !!  v1.60
!-
! Object getVariable String !! - !! Object getVariable Array !! - 
!-
! Group getVariable String !! - !! Group getVariable Array !! -
!-
! Team Member getVariable String !! - !! Team Member getVariable Array !! - 
!-
! Task getVariable String !! - !! Task getVariable Array !!  v1.68
!-
! Location getVariable String !! - !! Location getVariable Array !!  v1.68
!-
! Control getVariable String !! - !! Control getVariable Array !!  v1.56
!-
! Display getVariable String !!  v1.56 !! Display getVariable Array !!  v1.56
!}

args.name: varspace: Namespace, Object, Display, Control, Group, Location, Task, Team Member, Display, Control
varspace: Namespace, Object, Display, Control, Group, Location, Task, Team Member, Display, Control
defaultValue
args.desc: value to return if variable doesn't exist

returns.desc: current value of the variable or defaultValue if the variable doesn't exist.

gettext.title: getText
gettext.description:
Extracts localized text from config entry, if entry is subject to localization, otherwise returns text value.
To obtain the translation key itself, see getTextRaw.

getspeed.title: getSpeed
getspeed.description:
Get the speed for the given speed mode.

SpeedMode can be:
*"AUTO"
*"SLOW"
*"NORMAL"
*"FAST"

gethidefrom.title: getHideFrom
gethidefrom.description: Returns the Position where object believes the enemy to be. If there is no direct line of sight between the object and the enemy, this position is extrapolated based on the last known position and speed of the enemy. A returned position of [0,0,0] implies that object does not knowAbout enemy. If enemy is null it is some position in front of the object or enemy position.

returns.desc: ASLToATL representation of the believed aimPos of the enemy object

find.title: find
find.description: Searches for an array element within an array or an ANSI string within an ANSI string.

returns.desc: zero-based position of the first array element that matches x, -1 if not found
zero-based position of the first sequence of characters that matches substring, -1 if not found

args.name: indexStart
args.desc: zero-based index which defines where find starts from

returns.desc: zero-based position of the first sequence of characters that matches substring, -1 if not found

findcover.title: findCover
findcover.description: Returns the object around where the unit finds cover. The minDist, visibilityPosition and ignoreObject parameters are optional.

syntaxes.code: object findCover [position, hidePosition, maxDist, minDist, visibilityPosition, ignoreObject]

args.name: hidePosition: Array format Position#PositionATL - getHideFrom-like position from which the unit should hide
visibilityPosition: Array format Position - (Optional) used to select cover that unit can see in that direction from
ignoreObject
args.desc: (Optional) ignore this object in visibility check

finddisplay.title: findDisplay
finddisplay.description:
Finds a display by its IDD which can either be defined in missionConfigFile (description.ext) or configFile (config.cpp) or by its UI On Texture's unique name (see displayUniqueName).
If the specified display cannot be found, displayNull is returned.

findnearestenemy.title: findNearestEnemy
findnearestenemy.description: Finds the nearest enemy to the specified position. Returns a null object if the object's group does not know about any enemies. This command will return nearest object that is known to the unit and is considered enemy. An empty vehicle that is part of enemy group assets (see addVehicle) can be returned as valid nearest target.

args.name: position: Object or Array in format PositionAGL or Position2D

finite.title: finite
finite.description: Returns true if the provided number is finite (not infinite and a valid number).

floor.title: floor
floor.description: Returns the next lowest integer in relation to the provided number.

fog.title: fog
fog.description: A getter for setFog. Returns the current value of the fog in range 0..1.

fogforecast.title: fogForecast
fogforecast.description: Returns the forecast fog value. A value of 0 means no fog, 1 means maximum fog.

from.title: from
from.description: Continue sequence of for construct. It sets the start value of the index variable.

forcespeed.title: forceSpeed
forcespeed.description: Force the speed limit on given object (object will never attempt to move faster than given by forceSpeed). Use negative value to return to default behaviour.

formationdirection.title: formationDirection
formationdirection.description: Return the direction in degrees of the 'unit' watching in formation.

formationmembers.title: formationMembers
formationmembers.description: Return list of units (drivers) in the formation.

formationposition.title: formationPosition
formationposition.description: Return position of unit in the formation.

echo.title: echo
echo.description: Sends any text into the debugger console or the logfile. This command is only present in internal version  not in the retail version. Use diag_log instead!

effectivecommander.title: effectiveCommander
effectivecommander.description: Returns the effective commander of the vehicle. Effective commander is the player whom driver AI will listen to. So if in a tank there is a gunner and a commander and AI driver, if the effectiveCommander is gunner, then gunner pressing WASD will give AI orders to move. If gunner jumps out and then enters tank again, the effectiveCommander role most likely has changed to commander that remained in tank. Also the assignment seems to work on first come first served basis.

setaperture.title: setAperture
setaperture.description: Sets custom eye accommodation camera aperture.

args.name: aperture
args.desc: aperture value; a value `c <= 0` will set the aperture automatically. Maximum value which has an effect seems to be `100`.

emptypositions.title: emptyPositions
emptypositions.description: Returns the number of given empty positions in the vehicle.

enablereload.title: enableReload
enablereload.description: Enable / disable reload when magazine is empty.

enableteamswitch.title: enableTeamSwitch
enableteamswitch.description: Enable / disable Team Switch. The default setting is enabled.

execvm.title: execVM
execvm.description:
Compiles and adds an SQF script to the scheduler queue and returns script handle (see also ).
The script does not execute immediately upon running execVM command but with some delay depending on the VM's scripts queue and engine load.

args.name: arguments
args.desc: arguments accessible as `_this` in the script

args.name: filename
args.desc: path to the SQF script file

args.name: filename
args.desc: path to the SQF script file

exitwith.title: exitWith
exitwith.description: Exits the current code scope. Often used for exiting do, for, count, forEach or the whole script.

expecteddestination.title: expectedDestination
expecteddestination.description: Return expected destination of unit as an array.

date.title: date
date.description: Return the actual in-mission date and time.

deletecollection.title: deleteCollection
deletecollection.description:
Delete a collection. As example, used with a soldier, it'll hide the ingame model.

When targetting Arma 2 1.06 or newer, use hideObject instead. This function is a relic from dynamic building destruction development. It is left only for compatibility with scripts created before Arma 2 1.06, and its functionality may be changed or removed in the future.

displayctrl.title: displayCtrl
displayctrl.description: Return child control with specified idc.

displaynull.title: displayNull
displaynull.description:
A non-existing Display. To compare non-existent displays use isNull or isEqualTo:

displayNull == displayNull;		// false
isNull displayNull;					// true
displayNull isEqualTo displayNull;	// true

displayseteventhandler.title: displaySetEventHandler
displayseteventhandler.description:
Sets given event handler of given display.
The return code of the provided function should indicate whether this event was handled correctly. This implies telling the engine whether it is default code should be executed. 
See User Interface Event Handlers for the full list of handler names.
If applicable, see DIK KeyCodes for a list of key code constants, which are relevant to key related user interface events like  and .

dofsm.title: doFSM
dofsm.description:
Orders a unit to process command defined by FSM file (silently). 

Unlike with execFSM where _this is passed to the FSM, the following parameters are passed when using doFSM/commandFSM:

; _leader: leader of subgroup with this command 
; _destination: command destination/position
; _target: command target 
; _units: list of all persons in subgroup

args.name: unit: Object or Array of objects

drawarrow.title: drawArrow
drawarrow.description:
Draws a single line arrow on the map.
As this command needs to be called every frame, it is preferable using the onDraw UI Event Handler.
To draw a color filled arrow of custom shape see BIS_fnc_drawArrow.

args.name: from: Object or Array in format Position2D or Position3D - arrow start position
to: Object or Array in format Position2D or Position3D - arrow end position

drawellipse.title: drawEllipse
drawellipse.description: File:drawEllipse.jpg250 Draws an ellipse on the map. Just like with marker or trigger area, negative a and b will result in hexagon.

syntaxes.code: map drawEllipse [centre, a, b, angle, color, fill]

args.name: centre: Object or Array format Position2D, Position3D - ellipse's centre
color: Array format Color (RGBA) - line color
fill
args.desc: fill texture file or Procedural Textures. Note that the file texture will not rotate with rectangle, use drawIcon for that. If fill texture is not empty, set line color to white [1,1,1,1]

drawicon.title: drawIcon
drawicon.description:
Draws an icon on the map.
As this command needs to be called every frame, it is preferable using the onDraw UI Event Handler.

syntaxes.code: map drawIcon [texture, color, position, width, height, angle, text, shadow, textSize, font, align, drawSideArrows, offsetX, offsetY]

args.name: color
args.desc: text and icon color in format Color(RGBA)

args.name: position: Object, Array format Position2D or Position3D
width
args.desc: width of the icon (but not the text)

args.name: height
args.desc: height of the icon (but not the text)

args.name: angle
args.desc: rotation angle of the icon (but not the text)

args.name:
shadow: Number or Boolean - (Optional, default false) can be one of:
* 0 (false): no shadow
* 1: shadow (for text)
* 2 (true): outline (works for text and for icon only if icon angle is 0)
textSize
args.desc: (Optional, default -1) size of the text in UI units

args.name:
align: String - (Optional, default "right") text alignment. Can be:
* "left"
* "right"
* "center"

drawline.title: drawLine
drawline.description: Draw a line on the map. Can decrease framerate!

args.name: from: Object or Array format Position2D or Position3D
to: Object or Array format Position2D or Position3D

drawrectangle.title: drawRectangle
drawrectangle.description: Draws a rectangle on the map. File:drawRectangle.jpg250

syntaxes.code: map drawRectangle  [centre, halfWidth, halfHeight, angle, color, fill]

args.name: centre: Object or Array in format Position2D or Position3D - rectangle's centre
color: Array format Color (RGBA) - line color
fill
args.desc: fill texture file or Procedural Textures. Note that the file texture will not rotate with rectangle, use drawIcon for that. If fill texture is not empty, set line color to white  inline[1,1,1,1]

default.title: default
default.description: Defines a Switch Type default case - does not need a colon to define its block. See switch for more information.

camerainterest.title: cameraInterest
camerainterest.description: Return camera interest for given entity, as set by setCameraInterest, or as autodetected.

cameraon.title: cameraOn
cameraon.description: Returns the vehicle to which the camera is attached. If you need the person, see focusOn.

campaignconfigfile.title: campaignConfigFile
campaignconfigfile.description: Returns root of campaign description.ext entries hierarchy.

case.title: case
case.description: This command is used as a keyword inside a switch structure to define a value case.

catch.title: catch
catch.description: Processes code when an exception is thrown in a try block. The exception caught can be found in the _exception variable.

cheatsenabled.title: cheatsEnabled
cheatsenabled.description: Checks whether cheats are enabled (whether the designers' version is running).

closedisplay.title: closeDisplay
closedisplay.description:
Closes given display with exit code. It does not instantly close the display but does it on next simulation cycle. Most common exit codes are:
 langcpp
#define IDC_OK		1 // emulate "OK" button
#define IDC_CANCEL	2 // emulate "Cancel" button

commandfsm.title: commandFSM
commandfsm.description: Orders a unit to process command defined by FSM file (via the radio).

configfile.title: configFile
configfile.description: Return root of config entries hierarchy.

controlnull.title: controlNull
controlnull.description: A non-existing Control. To compare non-existent objects use isNull or isEqualTo (see examples).

createagent.title: createAgent
createagent.description: Creates an agent of the given type. An agent does not have a group or leader or the standard soldier FSM associated with it - for instance, an enemy soldier spawned as an agent has limited AI and will do nothing when fired upon - which can be useful to limit the amount of AI processing being done in a mission with very large numbers of "AI". Animals are also commonly created as agents.

args.name: position: Object or Array format PositionAGL or Position2D - desired placement position
markers
args.desc: if the markers array contains any markers, the position is randomly picked from array of given markers plus desired placement position. If any of the markers were given z coordinate with setMarkerPos, the vehicle will also be created at given z coordinate.

args.name: placement
args.desc: placement radius, the unit is randomly place in a circle with this radius

args.name:
special: String - one of:
* `"NONE"` - will look for a suitable empty position near given position (subject to other placement params) before creating the agent
* `"CAN_COLLIDE"` - creates the agent at given position (subject to other placement params), without checking if others objects can cross its 3D model

createdisplay.title: createDisplay
createdisplay.description:
Creates child display of given display and loads from "resourceName". The notable difference between createDisplay and createDialog is that with createDisplay the player would be able to move around while the display is shown.
Displays created with createDisplay or createDialog will take control of the mouse pointer and will close when user presses .

args.name: resourceName
args.desc: custom display class defined in description.ext or existing display class from main config

setmouseposition.title: setMousePosition
setmouseposition.description: Moves mouse pointer to specified position on the screen. x and y could be any number, but will be clipped so mouse never leaves the screen area.

setplayable.title: setPlayable
setplayable.description: Create a multiplayer role for the unit. The roles created this way are used for Join In Progress and Team Switch.

ctrlactivate.title: ctrlActivate
ctrlactivate.description: Launches action attached to given (button based) control. Command ignores control disabled state. (Example 2). Main syntax command only triggers engine-based actions (cancel or ok codes) and will not trigger button related User Interface Event Handlers or buttonAction, use the alternative syntax for this. "ButtonClick" UI event handler will also be triggered with the alternative syntax. Use isUIContext to distinguish between scripted activation and user activation.

args.name: control
args.desc: button based control (CT_BUTTON, CT_XBUTTON, CT_SHORTCUTBUTTON, CT_ACTIVETEXT)

args.name: full
args.desc: true to simulate button click in full including UI event handling

ctrlcommit.title: ctrlCommit
ctrlcommit.description: Commits control animation to last specified duration.

ctrlsetfont.title: ctrlSetFont
ctrlsetfont.description: Sets the font for given control (see available fonts)

args.name: fontName
args.desc: one of the fonts defined in CfgFontFamilies

ctrlsetfonth1.title: ctrlSetFontH1
ctrlsetfonth1.description: Sets H1 font of given HTML control.

ctrlsetfonth1b.title: ctrlSetFontH1B
ctrlsetfonth1b.description: Sets H1 bold font of given HTML control.

ctrlsetfonth2.title: ctrlSetFontH2
ctrlsetfonth2.description: Sets H2 font of given HTML control

ctrlsetfonth2b.title: ctrlSetFontH2B
ctrlsetfonth2b.description: Sets H2 bold font of given HTML control.

ctrlsetfonth3.title: ctrlSetFontH3
ctrlsetfonth3.description: Sets H3 font of given HTML control.

ctrlsetfonth3b.title: ctrlSetFontH3B
ctrlsetfonth3b.description: Sets H3 bold font of given HTML control.

ctrlsetfonth4.title: ctrlSetFontH4
ctrlsetfonth4.description: Sets H4 font of given HTML control.

ctrlsetfonth4b.title: ctrlSetFontH4B
ctrlsetfonth4b.description: Sets H4 bold font of given HTML control.

ctrlsetfonth5.title: ctrlSetFontH5
ctrlsetfonth5.description: Sets H5 font of given HTML control.

ctrlsetfonth5b.title: ctrlSetFontH5B
ctrlsetfonth5b.description: Sets H5 bold font of given HTML control.

ctrlsetfonth6.title: ctrlSetFontH6
ctrlsetfonth6.description: Sets H6 font of given HTML control.

ctrlsetfonth6b.title: ctrlSetFontH6B
ctrlsetfonth6b.description: Sets H6 bold font of given HTML control.

setvariable.title: setVariable
setvariable.description:
Set variable to given value in the variable space of given element. Can be used to broadcast variables over the network.
To remove a variable, set it to nil (see ) - note that this does not work on Object and scripted Location namespaces (the variable will be set to nil but will remain listed by allVariables).

args.name: varspace: variable space in which variable can be set. Can be one of:

public - (Optional, default false) can be one of:
* Boolean - if set to true, the variable is broadcast globally and is persistent (JIP compatible) 
* Number - the variable is only set on the client with the given Machine network ID. If the number is negative, the variable is set on every client except for the one with the given ID.
* Array of Numbers - array of Machine network IDs

This parameter is only available if the varspace parameter is a Namespace, Object or Group. Furthermore, only the following Data Types can be broadcast:
{! classwikitable align-center
! Type
! Number
! Boolean
! Object
! Group
! String
! Text
! Array
! Code
! Nothing (nil)
! HashMap
!-
! Since
! colspan6  
! colspan2  
! 
! 
!}

ctrlsetfontheight.title: ctrlSetFontHeight
ctrlsetfontheight.description:
Sets the `sizeEx` property for most controls as follows: 
* `CT_MAP` - "sizeExNames"
* `CT_HTML` - "P" >> "sizeEx"
* Other - "sizeEx"
*  `CT_STRUCTURED_TEXT` - "size"

ctrlsetfontheighth1.title: ctrlSetFontHeightH1
ctrlsetfontheighth1.description: Sets H1 font size of given HTML control.

ctrlsetfontheighth2.title: ctrlSetFontHeightH2
ctrlsetfontheighth2.description: Sets H2 font size of given HTML control.

ctrlsetfontheighth3.title: ctrlSetFontHeightH3
ctrlsetfontheighth3.description: Sets H3 font size of given HTML control.

ctrlsetfontheighth4.title: ctrlSetFontHeightH4
ctrlsetfontheighth4.description: Sets H4 font size of given HTML control.

ctrlsetfontheighth5.title: ctrlSetFontHeightH5
ctrlsetfontheighth5.description: Sets H5 font size of given HTML control.

ctrlsetfontheighth6.title: ctrlSetFontHeightH6
ctrlsetfontheighth6.description: Sets H6 font size of given HTML control.

setformationtask.title: setFormationTask
setformationtask.description: Set the current task of the formation member.

scopename.title: scopeName
scopename.description: Defines name of current scope. Name is visible in debugger, and name is also used as reference in some commands like breakOut and breakTo. Scope name should be defined only once per scope. Trying to set a different name on the scope that has already defined scope name will result in error.

selectionposition.title: selectionPosition
selectionposition.description:
Returns selection position in model space pertaining to the current animation in render time scope.
When the default syntax is used, command searches first in Memory LOD, then in Geometry LOD, FireGeometry LOD, LandContact LOD, HitPoints LOD and finally in ViewGeometry LOD and returns the first matching find.
The second syntax allows to specify which one of these LODs to search in instead.

returns.desc: relative position in model space. If selection does not exist, [0, 0, 0] is returned.

args.name:
LOD: String or Number - can be one of:
* `"Memory"`
* `"Geometry"`
* `"FireGeometry"`
* `"LandContact"`
* `"HitPoints"`
*  `"ViewGeometry"`
When Number is used, command searches for a LOD with the similar LOD resolution

returnMode: String - (Optional, default `"FirstPoint"`) can be one of:
* `"FirstPoint"`
* `"AveragePoint"`
* `"BoundingBox"`

returns.desc: relative position in model space. If selection does not exist, [0, 0, 0] is returned. If returnMode is `"BoundingBox"`, Array of Arrays

args.name: LODIndex
args.desc: the index of the target LOD (see allLODs)

args.name: isVisual
args.desc: (Optional, default true) true for Render, false for Simulation time scope

args.name:
returnMode: String - (Optional, default `"FirstPoint"`) can be one of:
* `"FirstPoint"`
* `"AveragePoint"`
* `"BoundingBox"`

returns.desc: relative position in model space. If selection does not exist, [0, 0, 0] is returned. If returnMode is `"BoundingBox"`, Array of Arrays

setdestination.title: setDestination
setdestination.description:
Set the destination for path planning of the pilot.

Possible values for planningMode are:

* "DoNotPlan" - used when not moving
* "DoNotPlanFormation" - used in formation when simple path testing is used
* "LEADER PLANNED" - used for formation leader (full path finding used)
* "LEADER DIRECT" - used for DirectGo (like getin, supply)
* "FORMATION PLANNED" - used in formation when full path finding is used
* "VEHICLE PLANNED" - used for vehicle driver

Works best when used on agents. Using "LEADER PLANNED" will trigger `"PathCalculated"`  Event Handler

args.name: forceReplan
args.desc: specifies if replanning of the path should be forced.

sideenemy.title: sideEnemy
sideenemy.description:
The enemy side which is used for renegades. Units of this side are hostile to everyone.
* To join sideEnemy, you can attack members of your own side or use addRating.
* When below a rating of -2000 units switch automatically to this side.

sidefriendly.title: sideFriendly
sidefriendly.description: The Friendly side - friendly to all, see Side Relations.

sidelogic.title: sideLogic
sidelogic.description: The Logic side. Side of Game Logics and Modules.

sleep.title: sleep
sleep.description: Suspends code execution for given time in seconds. The sleep precision is given by a framerate, the delay given is the minimal delay expected. Must be called inside of a context which is interruptible, i.e. a script executed by execVM or spawn.

args.name: delay
args.desc: in seconds. Negative values will not be considered.

step.title: step
step.description: Optional step value. A countdown can be made with a negative value. If not set, the default step is 1.

str.title: str
str.description: Converts any value into a string, depending on its type. If an Object has a vehicleVarName, it is returned (see ).

returns.desc: if value is a String, double quotes `""` will surround it (see )

supportinfo.title: supportInfo
supportinfo.description:
Creates a list of supported operators and type. Each field of array has the format: "x:name" Where x can be:
*'t' - type
*'n' - nullar operator
*'u' - unary operator
*'b' - binary operator.

'name' is the operator or type name (in case operator, type of input operands is included). 
mask parameter can be an empty string, or one of field. In this case, function returns empty array, if operator is not included in the list. Limited wildcard support is available. Type x may be replaced with *, meaning all types. For the mask partial match may be used, like abc*, meaning any operators starting with 'abc' are reported, for example: 
* `""` - list all types and commands
* `"t:*"` - list all types
* `"*:<command>*"` - list all entries for script <command>
*  `"i:<command>"` - extended information about script <command>, Array of Array of Strings in format:[type, lowerCaseName, camelCaseName, description, example, result, resultType, leftArgType, rightArgType,  syntax]

returns.desc: array with requested info or empty array `[]`

switchableunits.title: switchableUnits
switchableunits.description:
Returns a list of playable units available for switching to
* Command is relative to the client on which it is executed and will only show playable units for the same side as player's group + player himself
* In singleplayer where playable units from all sides will be accessible via this command
* Dead and player-controlled units are automatically removed from the resulting array
* In order to get all playable units regardless of their side, see the playableUnits command

ctrlcommitted.title: ctrlCommitted
ctrlcommitted.description: Check if the control animation is finished.

ctrlfade.title: ctrlFade
ctrlfade.description: Returns the current fade factor of control.

ctrlmapanimadd.title: ctrlMapAnimAdd
ctrlmapanimadd.description: Adds the next frame to the map animation.

args.name: time
args.desc: duration of the animation in seconds

args.name: zoom
args.desc: zoom in range from 0.001 (max) to 1 (min). Custom map scales can be set in map control's config. See also ctrlMapScale

args.name: position: Array or Object - formats: Position2D, Position3D, Object

ctrlsetforegroundcolor.title: ctrlSetForegroundColor
ctrlsetforegroundcolor.description: Sets foreground color of the given control.

ctrlsetscale.title: ctrlSetScale
ctrlsetscale.description: Sets scale of a control. Top left corner remains same. This command requires ctrlCommit.

ctrlsetstructuredtext.title: ctrlSetStructuredText
ctrlsetstructuredtext.description: Set the Structured Text which will be displayed in structured text control.

ctrlsettooltip.title: ctrlSetTooltip
ctrlsettooltip.description: Sets tooltip text of given control.

args.name: control
args.desc: any control type, (except for CT_STATIC & CT_STRUCTURED_TEXT, although Arma 3 now supports these too)

ctrlsettooltipcolorbox.title: ctrlSetTooltipColorBox
ctrlsettooltipcolorbox.description: Sets tooltip border color of given control.

args.name: color
args.desc: color in format in format Color (RGBA)

ctrlsettooltipcolorshade.title: ctrlSetTooltipColorShade
ctrlsettooltipcolorshade.description: Sets tooltip background color of given control. Color is in format Color (RGBA).

ctrlsettooltipcolortext.title: ctrlSetTooltipColorText
ctrlsettooltipcolortext.description: Sets tooltip text color of given control. Color is in format Color (RGBA).

ctrlsettextcolor.title: ctrlSetTextColor
ctrlsettextcolor.description: Sets text color of given control. Color is in format Color (RGBA). As of Arma 3 v1.40 this command can also be used to change fill-color of a CT_PROGRESS control.

ctrlmapanimdone.title: ctrlMapAnimDone
ctrlmapanimdone.description: Checks whether the map animation has finished.

ctrlsetfocus.title: ctrlSetFocus
ctrlsetfocus.description: Sets the input focus on given control.

ctrlsetfade.title: ctrlSetFade
ctrlsetfade.description: Sets wanted transparency for control animation. Requires ctrlCommit to commit changes. To hide or show a control instantly, use ctrlShow.

ctrlparent.title: ctrlParent
ctrlparent.description: Returns the parent Display of the given control. For parent Controls group see ctrlParentControlsGroup.

ctrlposition.title: ctrlPosition
ctrlposition.description:
Returns the current position of 2D control as `[x, y, w, h]` array. For 3D control it returns relative `[x, y, z]`.
If the control is within a CT_CONTROLS_GROUP, the returned position will be relative to the group's position.
If the control is a CT_CONTROLS_TABLE header or row the returned position is relative to the table's position.

ctrlscale.title: ctrlScale
ctrlscale.description: Returns the current scale of the control.

ctrlsetactivecolor.title: ctrlSetActiveColor
ctrlsetactivecolor.description: Sets text color of given control when it is selected.

ctrlsetbackgroundcolor.title: ctrlSetBackgroundColor
ctrlsetbackgroundcolor.description: Sets background color of given control. Only affects:

ctrlseteventhandler.title: ctrlSetEventHandler
ctrlseteventhandler.description: Sets given event handler of given control: any previously added event handler is removed.

args.name: function
args.desc: should return a Boolean indicating that the event has handled this event fully or not and whether the engine should execute its default code or not afterwards

ctrlshown.title: ctrlShown
ctrlshown.description: Returns whether given control is shown.

ctrltype.title: ctrlType
ctrltype.description: Returns number representing the type of control, which is also defined by type property in config. For more information see Arma: GUI Configuration

currentcommand.title: currentCommand
currentcommand.description: Return the current command type (empty string when no command) for the commander of given vehicle (or for a given soldier). Returned value can be one of:

boundingbox.title: boundingBox
boundingbox.description: File:Boundingbox.jpg200 Returns a bounding box of given object in model coordinate space, adjusted according to destruction/animation of an object. This command is rather generous on the size estimation, for more precise coordinates use boundingBoxReal.

returns.desc: an array with the extreme points of the model in format PositionRelative, as well as bounding box sphere diameter.Format [[xmin, ymin, zmin], [xmax, ymax, zmax], boundingSphereDiameter].

args.name:
clippingType: Number - clipping type could be:
* 0 - ClipVisual (could significantly reduce the size of bounding boxes on buildings)
* 1 - ClipShadow
* 2 - ClipGeometry
* 3 - ClipGeneral (Default, the same type that is used in main syntax)

returns.desc: an array with the extreme points of the model bounding box in format PositionRelative, as well as bounding box sphere diameter.Format [[xmin, ymin, zmin], [xmax, ymax, zmax], boundingSphereDiameter].

breakout.title: breakOut
breakout.description:
Breaks out of the scope with given name.
* An unknown scopeName name will cause the script error `Generic error in expression`
* If multiple scopes with the same name exist, the command will break out the nearest scope. See .

args.name: name
args.desc: name of the scope which was previously set with scopeName.  inline"" will exit the current scope (see also exitWith)

args.name: name
args.desc: name of the scope which was previously set with scopeName.  inline"" will exit the current scope (see also exitWith)

breakto.title: breakTo
breakto.description:
Breaks block to scope named name. Nil is returned.

Scope name can be assigned using scopeName command.

addswitchableunit.title: addSwitchableUnit
addswitchableunit.description:
Adds a unit to the list of units available for Team Switch. Units marked as playable in editor are automatically switchable.
This command adds non-playable unit into array of switchableUnits and makes them available for teamSwitch. Singleplayer only!

animationstate.title: animationState
animationstate.description: Returns the name of a unit's current primary animation. Seems to be forced to lower case in .

spawn.title: spawn
spawn.description:
Adds given set of compiled instructions to the scheduler.
Exactly when the code will be executed is unknown, it depends on how busy is the engine and how filled up is the scheduler.
Therefore spawn does not wait for the supplied code to finish, instead, spawn returns a Script handle to the scheduler task.
scriptDone command can be used to check the code completion. Additional arguments are passed to the code in local variable _this.
Since  the script handle also exists inside the code in `_thisScript` variable.
To see what spawned scripts are currently in the scheduler, use diag_activeSQFScripts command.

args.name: arguments
args.desc: arguments passed to the script, which later available in `_this` variable inside the script.

isnil.title: isNil
isnil.description: Tests whether a variable is nil or undefined from its identifier, or whether the given expression evaluates to nil or Nothing.

returns.desc: true if variable is nil or undefined

args.name:
code: Code - code to evaluate:
* the code will be executed;  inlineisNil { player setDamage 1 }; will kill the player
* the code will not be allowed to suspend while expression is evaluated, even if the parent scope allows it (see ).

returns.desc: true if code returns Nothing, false otherwise

args.name: namespace: Namespace, Object, Group or HashMap

returns.desc: true if variable is nil or undefined

dowatch.title: doWatch
dowatch.description: Order the given unit(s) to watch the given position or target (without radio messages). Use objNull as the target to order a unit to stop watching a position/target.

addeventhandler.title: addEventHandler
addeventhandler.description:
Adds an Event Handler to the given object.
* As many Event Handlers of any type can be added - existing Event Handlers do not get overwritten
* Use removeEventHandler to remove an Event Handler
Read Event Handlers for more information and a list of all available Event Handlers.

args.name: type
args.desc: see Event Handlers for the full list of available options

args.name:
code: Code or String - code that should be executed when the Event Handler fires; executed in missionNamespace by default. Several Magic Variables are available:
* Event Handler parameters are accessible via  inline_this
* The Event Handler type is available as  inline_thisEvent
* The Event Handler index is available as  inline_thisEventHandler

returns.desc: the index of the added Event Handler. Indices start at 0 for each unit and increment with each added Event Handler.

fire.title: fire
fire.description: Forces a unit to fire the given weapon.

args.name: unit
args.desc: unit that is supposed to fire

args.name: muzzle
args.desc: name of the muzzle to be fired

call.title: call
call.description:
Adds given set of compiled instructions to the current stack and waits for it to finish and return, provides an option to pass arguments to the executed Code.
See Scheduler to learn more about how the code is executed and behaves.

returns.desc: the last value given in the function is returned. See the topic Function for more information.

args.name: args
args.desc: arguments that are passed to the function in the  inline_this variable

returns.desc: the last value given in the function is returned. See the topic Function for more information.

args.name: hashMapObj
args.desc: the HashMap (not necessarily created through createHashMapObject) to call the method on

args.name: methodName
args.desc: the name of the method to call (the method must be defined in hashMapObj; see createHashMapObject)

args.name: arguments
args.desc: (Optional, default nil) arguments that are passed to the method in the  inline_this variable

returns.desc: the value returned by the methodName method

camcommitprepared.title: camCommitPrepared
camcommitprepared.description:
Smoothly conducts the changes that were assigned to a camera within the given time. If the time is set to zero, the changes are done immediately.
This command is for use with `camPrepareXXX` commands. For the normal cam command use camCommit.

args.name: time
args.desc: time in seconds in which the changes shall be done

worldname.title: worldName
worldname.description: Return the name of the currently loaded world.

playerrespawntime.title: playerRespawnTime
playerrespawntime.description: Return the player's remaining time before respawn, or -1 if it is not available (such as when the player is alive).

parsenumber.title: parseNumber
parsenumber.description: Parses the string, interpreting its content as a floating point number.

returns.desc: the parsed number, `0` if no valid number was found; in the case of a passed Boolean, 0 if false, 1 if true

onbriefingteamswitch.title: onBriefingTeamSwitch
onbriefingteamswitch.description: Select a sound defined in the CfgSounds of the mission to be played the first time the TeamSwitch tab is selected in the briefing.

flagowner.title: flagOwner
flagowner.description: Returns the global owner of a flag. A getter for setFlagOwner. Note that owner of a flag is Object rather than Number, as how it is usually with other owner commands

returns.desc: the person or vehicle that owns the flag is returned. If used on anything else than a flag, the returned value is objNull. If the flag is on its pole, the return value is NULL. If the flagowner is dead, the return value is the name of the soldier model

enableenvironment.title: enableEnvironment
enableenvironment.description:
Enable/disable environmental effects: ambient life and/or ambient sound.


Influenced sounds among others are:

*  thunder (an already started sound will not be cut but future ones will be prevented)

args.name: enable
args.desc: false to disable ambient life and ambient sounds, true to re-enable it

args.name: ambientLife
args.desc: enable/disable ambient life (bees, rabbits, birds, snakes, fish)

args.name: windyCoef
args.desc: (Optional, default 1) howling wind at heights, range 0..1

enableattack.title: enableAttack
enableattack.description: Set if leader can issue attack commands to the soldiers in his group.

campreparetarget.title: camPrepareTarget
campreparetarget.description: Prepares the camera target to a position or to a target. Needs the call of camCommitPrepared to be conducted.

cadetmode.title: cadetMode
cadetmode.description: Prior to  it returns if the player is currently playing in cadet or veteran mode.

returns.desc: true when playing in cadet mode, false when playing in veteran mode

campreload.title: camPreload
campreload.description: Preloads the scene for the prepared camera with given timeout after which preloading is aborted. Max timeout is 30 seconds. Timeout of 0 means max timeout of 30 seconds as well.

campreloaded.title: camPreloaded
campreloaded.description: Checks whether the camera has finished preloading.

campreparefocus.title: camPrepareFocus
campreparefocus.description:
focusRange is . Prepares the camera focus blur.

[-1,1] will reset default values (auto focusing), [-1,-1] will disable postprocessing (all is focused). Needs the call of camCommitPrepared to be conducted.

campreparefov.title: camPrepareFov
campreparefov.description: Prepares the camera field of view (zoom). The default zoom level is 0.75, 0.01 is the nearest and 2 the furthest zoom value. The angle of the field of view is atan(FOV)*2 radians when in 4:3 aspect ratio. Needs the call of camCommitPrepared to be conducted.

campreparefovrange.title: camPrepareFovRange
campreparefovrange.description: Prepares the camera field of view range for auto zooming.

campreparepos.title: camPreparePos
campreparepos.description: Prepares the camera position. Needs the call of camCommitPrepared to be conducted.

campreparerelpos.title: camPrepareRelPos
campreparerelpos.description: Prepares the camera position relative to the current position of the currect target (see camPrepareTarget). Needs the call of camCommitPrepared to be conducted.

and.title: and
and.description:
Returns true only if both conditions are true.
In case of the alternative syntax,  is used - if left operand is false, evaluation of the right side is ignored.

args.name: b
args.desc: code that returns Boolean. It is not evaluated if a is false

or.title: or
or.description: Returns true if one or both conditions are true. In case of the alternative syntax,  is used. That means that if left operand is true, evaluation of the right side is skipped completely.

args.name: b
args.desc: code that returns Boolean. It is not evaluated if a returns true

ctrlmapscale.title: ctrlMapScale
ctrlmapscale.description: Returns the current scale of given map control.

assignedtarget.title: assignedTarget
assignedtarget.description:
Returns the target assigned to an unit or the vehicle's effectiveCommander. The target can be assigned by the group/vehicle/formation leader (as player via quick command menu or "target" complex command menu).
To unassign the target use doWatch objNull or commandWatch objNull or as player and group leader order "no target" in the "target" complex command menu.

attackenabled.title: attackEnabled
attackenabled.description: Return whether a group's leader can issue attack commands to soldiers under his command.

createmarkerlocal.title: createMarkerLocal
createmarkerlocal.description:
Creates a local marker at the given position - the marker only exists on the machine that created it. The marker name has to be unique, if a marker with the given name exists, the command will be ignored. Use deleteMarkerLocal to delete a local marker.
If the position is given in 3D format, `z` coordinate is stored with the marker and will be used when marker is passed to commands like createVehicle, createUnit, createAgent, createMine, setVehiclePosition for example. However getMarkerPos and markerPos will always return 0 for `z`.

args.name: position: Array or Object - format position: Position2D, PositionAGL or Object (object's model centre is used (see getPosWorld))

returns.desc: the marker's name, or an empty string if the marker name is not unique

setmarkertextlocal.title: setMarkerTextLocal
setmarkertextlocal.description: Sets the text label of an existing marker.

setmarkershapelocal.title: setMarkerShapeLocal
setmarkershapelocal.description: Selects shape (actual type) of the local marker.

args.name:
shape: String - the shape, can be one of:
* `"ICON"`
* `"RECTANGLE"`
* `"ELLIPSE"`
* `"POLYLINE"`

setmarkerbrushlocal.title: setMarkerBrushLocal
setmarkerbrushlocal.description:
Selects the fill texture for the marker ("RECTANGLE" or "ELLIPSE"). Brush is the name of the subclass in CfgMarkerBrushes.


brush can be:
* "Solid"
* "SolidFull" (A3 only)
* "Horizontal"
* "Vertical"
* "Grid"
* "FDiagonal"
* "BDiagonal"
* "DiagGrid"
* "Cross"
* "Border" (A2/A3 only)
* "SolidBorder" (OA/A3 only)

setmarkerdirlocal.title: setMarkerDirLocal
setmarkerdirlocal.description: Sets the orientation of the marker.

args.name: angle
args.desc: angle of the marker in degree

setmarkerposlocal.title: setMarkerPosLocal
setmarkerposlocal.description: Moves the marker. If position is given in 3D format, `z` coordinate is stored with the marker and will be used when marker is passed to commands like createVehicle, createUnit, createAgent, createMine, setVehiclePosition for example. When Object is used for position, its getPosWorld is used.

args.name: pos: Array format Position2D, PositionAGL or  Object - object's model centre's position is used (see getPosWorld)

setmarkertypelocal.title: setMarkerTypeLocal
setmarkertypelocal.description: Sets marker type locally. Marker type is a class name in CfgMarkers.

setmarkercolorlocal.title: setMarkerColorLocal
setmarkercolorlocal.description: Sets marker color for the given marker locally. Marker color names and their corresponding RGBA values for Arma 3 could be found in here: Arma 3: CfgMarkerColors

!_a.title: !_a
!_a.description: Returns the negation of a Boolean expression. This means `true` becomes `false` and vice versa.

a_!=_b.title: a_!=_b
a_!=_b.description: Returns whether one value is not equal to another. String comparison is case-insensitive (e.g  inline"STRINGtext" != "stringTEXT" // returns false - strings are equivalent).

args.name:
a:
{! classwikitable
! Introduced in
! colspan5  
! colspan4  
! 
! colspan3  
!-
! Possible Type
! Number
! Side
! String
! Object
! Group
! Structured Text
! Config
! Display
! Control
! Location
! Diary Record
! Namespace
! Boolean
!}

returns.desc: true if a is different from b, false otherwise

a_greater_b.title: a_greater_b
a_greater_b.description: Returns true if a is greater than b, else returns false.

a_less=_b.title: a_less=_b
a_less=_b.description: Returns true if a is less than or equal to b, else returns false.

a_^_b.title: a_^_b
a_^_b.description: a raised to the power of b

a_%_b.title: a_%_b
a_%_b.description: Remainder of a divided by b.

setunitposweak.title: setUnitPosWeak
setunitposweak.description:
Set unit position rules. This command is the lowest level of priority for setting unit position and to be used in scripted	
FSM's. Priorities are:
# Unit pos commanded (from the commanding menu, higher priority).
# Unit pos scripted (from setUnitPos scripting command, medium priority).
# Unit pos FSM / setUnitPosWeak (used in the formation FSM, lowest priority).

args.name:
mode: String - can be:
* "DOWN" - Unit goes prone and stays prone.
* "UP" - Unit stands and stays standing.
* "MIDDLE" - Kneel Position.  - Unit will not kneel if it is unarmed
* "AUTO" - Unit chooses mode according to circumstances.

assignedvehicle.title: assignedVehicle
assignedvehicle.description: Returns the vehicle to which a unit is assigned, usually with assignAsXXX command. If no vehicle is assigned objNull is returned.

assignedvehiclerole.title: assignedVehicleRole
assignedvehiclerole.description: Returns the role a unit is assigned to within its assigned vehicle.

setcurrentwaypoint.title: setCurrentWaypoint
setcurrentwaypoint.description: Sets the currently active waypoint for a group.

distributionregion.title: distributionRegion
distributionregion.description:
Returns the numerical index for the distribution region of this copy of .
# USA
# Rest of the world

waypoints.title: waypoints
waypoints.description: Returns an array of waypoints for the specified unit/group.

addvehicle.title: addVehicle
addvehicle.description: Adds a specified vehicle for use by a specified AI led group.

ctrlmapscreentoworld.title: ctrlMapScreenToWorld
ctrlmapscreentoworld.description: Converts map screen coordinates into world coordinates. Unlike posScreenToWorld, this command returns world position is format [x, y], otherwise it is identical to posScreenToWorld.

ctrlmapworldtoscreen.title: ctrlMapWorldToScreen
ctrlmapworldtoscreen.description: Converts world coordinates into map screen coordinates. This command is identical to posWorldToScreen.

args.name: position : Array - world position in format Position2D or Position3D

difficultyenabled.title: difficultyEnabled
difficultyenabled.description: Checks specific difficulty settings of the current user. Difficulty flag names can be found in the ArmA profile file under class Difficulties/xxx/Flags (xxx being regular or veteran).

args.name:
flagName: String - difficulty flag name. Following values are available:
<spoiler text="Arma 3 Flags">

</spoiler>
<spoiler text="Arma 2 Flags">

</spoiler>

titlefadeout.title: titleFadeOut
titlefadeout.description: Terminate the title effect and set duration of the fade out phase to the given time. Same as cutFadeOut but for the title layer.

cutfadeout.title: cutFadeOut
cutfadeout.description: Terminates the effect in the given layer by fading it out according to the given duration. If named layer is used and it doesn't exist, it will be allocated. For title layer see titleFadeOut.

args.name: layerName
args.desc: effect layer name. Layer names are CaSe SeNsItIvE

joinsilent.title: joinSilent
joinsilent.description: Join all units in the array to given group silently (without radio message). To have a group member leave a group, join him with the grpNull group (e.g. `[guy1] joinSilent grpNull`), but beware, as brand new group is created for the leaving unit and this could result in the number of groups in a mission growing out of control.

isserver.title: isServer
isserver.description: Returns true if the machine executing the command is the server in a multiplayer game or is running single player. It will return true for both dedicated and player-hosted server. See also Multiplayer Scripting/machines.

sizeof.title: sizeOf
sizeof.description: Returns the diameter of bounding sphere of the object of given classname in meters. If you need to estimate the size of the object more precisely, use boundingBox or boundingBoxReal.

returns.desc: size returned is usually bigger than the biggest size of the object along any of the axes. For example if object is 10 x 4 x 5 the sizeOf value returned expected to be around 10.

createmissiondisplay.title: createMissionDisplay
createmissiondisplay.description: Create single missions display as a child of given display. The mission dialog will be set to the directory given as an argument "root".

lbsort.title: lbSort
lbsort.description: Sorts listbox entries alphabetically ascending by their lbText.

lbsortbyvalue.title: lbSortByValue
lbsortbyvalue.description: Sorts the ListBox entries by lbValue. The entries are sorted in ascending order. Also note that this command will mix up the entries randomly if multiple entries have the same value. In  use lbSortBy to avoid this problem.

formationtask.title: formationTask
formationtask.description: Return the current task of the unit in the formation.

halt.title: halt
halt.description: This command was meant to break the script into debugger, however currently it does not do anything except displaying and logging the following error: `Error Debugger breakpoint hit`.

airportside.title: airportSide
airportside.description: Gets the side of an airport, set by setAirportSide. Default side is sideUnknown.

settype.title: setType
settype.description: Changes a location to the specified class. Location classes are defined in CfgLocationTypes.

drawlocation.title: drawLocation
drawlocation.description: Used to draw locations in 2D Editor.

setimportance.title: setImportance
setimportance.description: Sets the importance value of location.

attachobject.title: attachObject
attachobject.description: Attaches a location to the specified object. To detach a location, attach it to objNull.

setname.title: setName
setname.description: Sets the name of a location or a person (person only in single player).

setsize.title: setSize
setsize.description:
Sets the size (radius)  of a location.

The width  is 2 * x, the height is 2 * y.

settext.title: setText
settext.description: Sets the text associated with a location. This text will be displayed on the game map at the location's position.

setdirection.title: setDirection
setdirection.description: Sets the orientation of a location. The location's area and map icon (if its type uses an icon) will be rotated to this orientation.

setposition.title: setPosition
setposition.description: Sets the position of a location.

setrectangular.title: setRectangular
setrectangular.description: Set the shape of a location to be either rectangular or elliptical. Locations default shape is elliptical.

args.name: set
args.desc: true set rectangular, false set elliptical

setside.title: setSide
setside.description: Sets a location's side. The default side is Unknown.

nearestlocations.title: nearestLocations
nearestlocations.description: Returns an array of locations of chosen type(s) within the given radius of the given position, sorted from nearest to farthest.

args.name: centre: Array format Position2D, Position3D or Object
locationTypes: Array of Strings - list of location type names, e.g "NameCity";  passing empty array [] will return all available locations within the radius
radius
args.desc: maximum distance from the given position that returned locations may be, in metres

args.name: sortPosition: Array format Position2D, Position3D or Object - (Optional) results will be sorted from the distance to given sortPosition (nearest to farthest still)

rectangular.title: rectangular
rectangular.description: Checks if a location is rectangular (returns true) or elliptical (returns false).

type.title: type
type.description: Returns a string of a Location's class name or Task's name (same as taskName).

locationposition.title: locationPosition
locationposition.description: Returns the position of a location. If the location is attached to an object, that object's position is returned.

attachedobject.title: attachedObject
attachedobject.description: Returns the object a location is attached to. If the location is unattached, then objNull is returned.

createlocation.title: createLocation
createlocation.description:
Creates a location of the specified class and dimensions at the specified position.
Classes are defined in `CfgLocationTypes`; for possible location types see Location Types.
The alternative syntax allows to convert a non-editable (built-in) terrain location into an editable one, with the following restrictions:
* it cannot be deleted (but can be setType to "Invisible" to hide it)
* it cannot be moved

args.name: location
args.desc: a terrain's location. If a scripted location is provided, it is simply returned

nearestlocation.title: nearestLocation
nearestlocation.description: Return the closest location of specified class to a given position. Checked range is unlimited (i.e. covers the whole map).

args.name: position: Object or Array in format PositionAGL or Position2D
locationType: String of a location class name. If "" is supplied, any nearest location is returned. Since Arma 3 2.14 locationType could be an Array of location types. See Location Types
maxDistance
args.desc: (Optional) max search radius. Default - unlimited range.

tolower.title: toLower
tolower.description: Converts the supplied Unicode string to all lowercase characters. If the string doesn't have characters with codes > 255, use toLowerANSI.

toupper.title: toUpper
toupper.description: Converts the supplied Unicode string to all uppercase characters. If the string doesn't have characters with codes > 255, use toUpperANSI.

tostring.title: toString
tostring.description: Converts the supplied Array of Numbers into a String through  characters representation conversion, or provided Code to compilable String.

returns.desc: numbers converted to String of characters

toarray.title: toArray
toarray.description: Converts the supplied String into an Array of Numbers. The numbers in the created array are the decimal  representations of characters.

addpublicvariableeventhandler.title: addPublicVariableEventHandler
addpublicvariableeventhandler.description:
This event handler will detect if a missionNamespace variable (it is attached to) has been broadcast over network with publicVariable, publicVariableClient or publicVariableServer commands and will execute EH code upon detection. Arguments passed to the code in _this array are:
* _this select 0: String - broadcast variable name (same variable name EH is attached to)
* _this select 1: Anything - broadcast variable value 
* _this select 2: Object, Group - target the variable got set on with setVariable  (see )

args.name: code
args.desc: by default, the code is executed in missionNamespace

args.name: varName
args.desc: name of the variable set on target with setVariable

args.name: target: Object, Group or Team Member

setvectordirandup.title: setVectorDirAndUp
setvectordirandup.description:
File:Vectordirandup.jpg300 Sets orientation of an object.
The command takes 2 vector arrays, one for vectorDir and one for vectorUp.
Default object orientation will always have vectorDir pointing forward (North) along Y axis and vectorUp pointing up along Z axis - [[0,1,0],[0,0,1]], as shown on the diagram below (see also BIS_fnc_transformVectorDirAndUp).

When attaching object to an object the axes are relative to the object that gets the attachment.
If it is player object for example, then X goes from left to right, Y goes from back to front, and Z goes from down up.

The setDir command is incompatible with setVectorDirAndUp and should not be used together on the same object.
Using setVectorDirAndUp alone should be sufficient for any orientation.

assigntoairport.title: assignToAirport
assigntoairport.description: Assigns a plane to an airport ID or object.

args.name: target
args.desc: airport object. For example an aircraft carrier, see Arma 3: Dynamic Airport Configuration

landat.title: landAt
landat.description: Order an AI airplane to land at a given airport. ID is the number to identify which map airport you want the airplane to land at. See Arma: Airport IDs for more information.

args.name: heliPad
args.desc: A helipad object (can be an invisible helipad)

args.name: mode
args.desc: Landing mode. See the land command

returns.desc: Returns true if landing command was issued successfully. false if failed.

setairportside.title: setAirportSide
setairportside.description: Set owning side of the airport. ID is the number to identify which airport on the island you want to check.

allowdamage.title: allowDamage
allowdamage.description: Enables / disables an entity's ability to receive damage. This command does not prevent the entity from taking scripted damage from commands such as setDamage, setHit, setHitIndex or setHitPointDamage.

addeditorobject.title: addEditorObject
addeditorobject.description: Add an object to the editor and assign arguments. Create script is,called with _new equal to true. Returns the ID of the new EditorObject.,Subtype class is optional.

addgroupicon.title: addGroupIcon
addgroupicon.description: Adds icon to a group leader. Returns icon ID, Control icons visibility with setGroupIconsVisible.

args.name: group
args.desc: group to which add the icon

args.name: iconClass
args.desc: class name of an icon from `CfgGroupIcons`

args.name: offset: Array of Numbers - (Optional, default [0,0]) X and Y offsets of the icon in format [offsetX, offsetY]

addmenu.title: addMenu
addmenu.description: Adds a new menu button. Priority is optional.

addmenuitem.title: addMenuItem
addmenuitem.description: Creates a new menu item. Menu can be "file" or "view",index is index,as returned from addMenu command. priority is optional and determines,where in the menu the item will reside (higher priority items first).

addteammember.title: addTeamMember
addteammember.description:
Add given member to given team. Effect is local, unless both member and team are local to PC on which command is executed, then effect is global.

 The same Team Member can be member of several different teams at the same time.

agent.title: agent
agent.description: Return a person for a given agent.

agents.title: agents
agents.description: Return a list of agents in the current mission.

aisfinishheal.title: AISFinishHeal
aisfinishheal.description: Alternative Injury Simulation (AIS) end state. Used to tell engine that script side healing is done when using "HandleHeal" event handler.

allgroups.title: allGroups
allgroups.description: Return a list of all groups created on the following sides east, west, resistance/independent and civilian only. Does not contain groups of sideLogic.

allunits.title: allUnits
allunits.description: Returns a list of all units, except agents, dead units or units waiting for respawn, outside and inside vehicles that were created on the following sides east, west, independent and civilian.

armorypoints.title: armoryPoints
armorypoints.description: Returns, stored in [USERNAME].ArmaXProfile, value of armoryPoints entry. If the entry doesn't exist, it returns 0.

assignedcargo.title: assignedCargo
assignedcargo.description: Returns the list of soldiers assigned to the given vehicle as a cargo.

assignedcommander.title: assignedCommander
assignedcommander.description: Returns the soldier assigned to the given vehicle as a commander.

assigneddriver.title: assignedDriver
assigneddriver.description: Returns the soldier assigned to the given vehicle as a driver.

assignedgunner.title: assignedGunner
assignedgunner.description: Returns the soldier assigned to the given vehicle as a gunner.

attachto.title: attachTo
attachto.description:
Attaches an object to another object.
* The offset is applied to the object center unless a memory point is provided, in which case the offset will be applied to the memory point position.
* If no offset is specified, the current offset between the two objects will be used.

args.name: offset: Array format PositionRelative - (Optional) the position relative to object2's position
followBoneRotation
args.desc: (Optional) follows the memory point's rotation (if attached to one)

boundingcenter.title: boundingCenter
boundingcenter.description: Returns the position of the original (loaded) center of an object in model coordinates. Despite its name, it has nothing to do with boundingBox or boundingBoxReal, it returns offset where `[0, 0, 0]` was Object Builder / Oxygen 2 when model was created.

buildingexit.title: buildingExit
buildingexit.description: Returns the given indexed exit in a building. The returned value is in format Position.

camconstuctionsetparams.title: camConstuctionSetParams
camconstuctionsetparams.description: Sets construction camera parameters. To work with "camconstruct" object.

cameraeffectenablehud.title: cameraEffectEnableHUD
cameraeffectenablehud.description: Enable / disable showing of in-game UI during currently active camera effect. By default the HUD is off, which will make results of drawIcon3D invisible, for example.

cameraview.title: cameraView
cameraview.description:
Returns mode of active camera view. Mode is one of: 
* "INTERNAL" (1st person)
* "EXTERNAL" (3rd person)
* "GUNNER" (optics / sights)
* "GROUP" (commander view)

canunloadincombat.title: canUnloadInCombat
canunloadincombat.description: Returns config value of `unloadInCombat` for a vehicle. Alternatively see getUnloadInCombat

captivenum.title: captiveNum
captivenum.description:
Checks whether the unit is a captive. If the unit is a vehicle, its commander is checked instead.
If a unit's captivity level was set as a Boolean, then the returned number is either 0 (for false) or 1 (for true).

returns.desc: anything from 0 to value set by setCaptive alt syntax. A non zero value means captive.

closeoverlay.title: closeOverlay
closeoverlay.description: Closes the current overlay without committing.

commandchat.title: commandChat
commandchat.description: Types text to the command radio channel. The text will be visible only on the PC where command was executed. If you need the message to show on all computers, you have to execute it globally (see remoteExec)

args.name: side
args.desc: side to which the message will be seen

args.name: identity
args.desc: class name of one of the identities in CfgHQIdentities. Possible identities in  are:

commandingmenu.title: commandingMenu
commandingmenu.description: Returns the name of the topmost commanding menu or "" if the menu is closed. For action menu visibility check see isActionMenuVisible. See  for / structure.

commandradio.title: commandRadio
commandradio.description: Sends the audio message to the command radio channel. The message is defined in CfgRadio in the description.ext file or config radio protocol. The transmission will play only on the PC where command was executed. If you need the transmission to play on all computers, you have to execute it globally (see remoteExec).

args.name: side
args.desc: side to which the transmission will be played

args.name: identity
args.desc: class name of one of the identities in CfgHQIdentities. Possible identities in  are:

completedfsm.title: completedFSM
completedfsm.description: Checks whether the given FSM is completed. The FSM handle is the number returned by the execFSM command.

copyfromclipboard.title: copyFromClipboard
copyfromclipboard.description: Return ANSI content of the (text) clipboard. If Unicode support is desired, see forceUnicode.

copytoclipboard.title: copyToClipboard
copytoclipboard.description: Copies ANSI text string to the clipboard. If Unicode support is desired, see forceUnicode.

copywaypoints.title: copyWaypoints
copywaypoints.description: Copy the chain of waypoints from source to target group. The target group will start to process waypoints from the first one.

creatediarylink.title: createDiaryLink
creatediarylink.description: Creates a link to the given diary entry.

args.name: record: Object, Task or Diary Record

returns.desc: empty string or a string similar to the result of  inlineformat ["<log subject=""%1"" record=""%2"">%3</log>", subject, processedRecordId, text]

creatediaryrecord.title: createDiaryRecord
creatediaryrecord.description:
Creates a Diary entry. Supported tags and their parameters: <spoiler>
{

syntaxes.code: player createDiaryRecord [subject, textInfo, task, taskState, showTitle]

args.name:
textInfo: String or Array of Strings - can be:
* String - the record's content - its title will be empty
* Array of Strings - format [title, text, icon]:
** title: String
** text: String
**  icon: String - (Optional) icon to show next to the title
taskState
args.desc: (Optional, default `"NONE"`) changes the state of the given task. Can be one of:

args.name: showTitle
args.desc: (Optional, default true) whether or not to show title in the description section as well

creatediarysubject.title: createDiarySubject
creatediarysubject.description: Creates a new subject in the Diary.

args.name: picture
args.desc: (Optional, default `""`) icon to display next to the subject. Can be set later with setDiarySubjectPicture. Similar to lbSetPictureRight.

returns.desc: index of the entry that was added

creategeardialog.title: createGearDialog
creategeardialog.description: Opens gear dialog for given unit.

createsimpletask.title: createSimpleTask
createsimpletask.description: Creates a new Task and adds it to the Diary.

args.name: unit
args.desc: unit to add this new task

args.name: parentTask
args.desc: (Optional, taskNull) - The new task will be a sub task of the parent task

createtask.title: createTask
createtask.description: Create a new AI task (subtask of parentTask). Type is name of registered task type.

syntaxes.code: teamMember createTask [[type, parentTask], priority, name1, value1, ...]

createteam.title: createTeam
createteam.description: Creates a Team and names it.

ctrladdeventhandler.title: ctrlAddEventHandler
ctrladdeventhandler.description: Add an event handler to the given control.

args.name: handler
args.desc: handler name, see User Interface Event Handlers

args.name:
function: String, since  also Code - script. Several Magic Variables are available:
* Event Handler parameters are accessible via `_this`
* The Event Handler type is available as `_thisEvent`
* The Event Handler index is available as `_thisEventHandler`

ctrlautoscrolldelay.title: ctrlAutoScrollDelay
ctrlautoscrolldelay.description:
Returns number of seconds auto-scroll will wait before scroll and/or rewind. -2 if scrollbar not present. 

Autorscroll is available for CT_LISTBOX and CT_CONTROLS_GROUP types of controls only. Autoscroll will wait ctrlAutoScrollDelay seconds (must be  > 0) and then will scroll the scroll bar down to the bottom. ctrlAutoScrollSpeed defines the speed with which scrollbar is scrolled. If ctrlAutoScrollRewind is true, the control will fade out, immediately rewind to the top, then fade in, wait ctrlAutoScrollDelay seconds and then repeat the scrolling in a loop. If user focuses on the control, autoscrolling is interrupted.

ctrlautoscrollrewind.title: ctrlAutoScrollRewind
ctrlautoscrollrewind.description:
Returns true if auto-scroll should move back to start after it reaches the end.

Autorscroll is available for CT_LISTBOX and CT_CONTROLS_GROUP types of controls only. Autoscroll will wait ctrlAutoScrollDelay seconds (must be  > 0) and then will scroll the scroll bar down to the bottom. ctrlAutoScrollSpeed defines the speed with which scrollbar is scrolled. If ctrlAutoScrollRewind is true, the control will fade out, immediately rewind to the top, then fade in, wait ctrlAutoScrollDelay seconds and then repeat the scrolling in a loop. If user focuses on the control, autoscrolling is interrupted.

ctrlautoscrollspeed.title: ctrlAutoScrollSpeed
ctrlautoscrollspeed.description:
Returns number of seconds to auto-scroll one line. -1 if auto-scroll is disabled. -2 if scrollbar not present.
Autoscroll is available for CT_LISTBOX and CT_CONTROLS_GROUP types of controls only. Autoscroll will wait ctrlAutoScrollDelay seconds (must be  > 0) and then will scroll the scroll bar down to the bottom. ctrlAutoScrollSpeed defines the speed with which scrollbar is scrolled. If ctrlAutoScrollRewind is true, the control will fade out, immediately rewind to the top, then fade in, wait ctrlAutoScrollDelay seconds and then repeat the scrolling in a loop. If user focuses on the control, autoscrolling is interrupted.

ctrlmapcursor.title: ctrlMapCursor
ctrlmapcursor.description:
Changes the default cursor that appears when interacting with a map control to a custom one. Use an empty string to restore the default cursor.

The cursor is the name of a config entry from CfgWrapperUI / Cursors. This command has the following specifics:
* When used on the Main Map ( inlinefindDisplay 12 displayCtrl 51), it is possible to override multiple default cursors. For example, while leaving default "Arrow" intact, it is possible to just override "Scroll" with e.g "Wait" (See )
