hideobject.title: hideObject
hideobject.description: Hide entity. Can be used on soldiers and vehicles, also on static objects.

with.title: with
with.description: Creates a With Type that is used inside a do construct in order to execute code inside a given namespace.

addbackpack.title: addBackpack
addbackpack.description: Adds a backpack for a unit. If a unit already has a backpack, the old backpack will be placed on the ground under the unit. Items defined in the backpack's config will be added as well.

addmagazineturret.title: addMagazineTurret
addmagazineturret.description: Adds a magazine to the turret. Use turret path [-1] for driver's turret.

magazinesturret.title: magazinesTurret
magazinesturret.description: Returns all magazines of given turret. Use turret path [-1] for driver's turret. Alternatively, use magazinesAllTurrets.

args.name: includeEmpty
args.desc: (Optional, default true) - true = include empty magazines (behaviour as the primary syntax, but consistent), false = exclude empty magazines

removemagazineturret.title: removeMagazineTurret
removemagazineturret.description:
Removes the magazine from the turret. Use turret path [-1] for driver's turret.

Note: you may create invalid combinations by using this function. When doing so, application behaviour is undefined.

removemagazinesturret.title: removeMagazinesTurret
removemagazinesturret.description: Removes all magazines of the given type from given vehicle. Use turret path [-1] for driver's turret.

weaponsturret.title: weaponsTurret
weaponsturret.description: Returns all weapons of a given turret. Use turret path [-1] for driver's turret.

disabletiequipment.title: disableTIEquipment
disabletiequipment.description: Disables TI (Thermal Imaging) equipment for given vehicle.

args.name: state
args.desc: true to turn TI off, false to turn TI on

currentvisionmode.title: currentVisionMode
currentvisionmode.description:
Returns current vision mode of unit's weapon. Vision mode could be one of:
* 0 - normal vision
* 1 - night vision
* 2 - thermal vision
Alternative syntaxes additionally return FLIR index (see setCamUseTI) of the thermal vision mode (See also  "VisionModeChanged" entity event handler)

args.name: entity
args.desc: unit or vehicle. Unit query returns current vision mode of the unit. Vehicle query returns driver seat vision mode

args.name: entity
args.desc: unit or vehicle. Unit query returns current vision mode of the unit. Vehicle query returns driver seat vision mode

args.name: turretPath: Array format Turret Path - path to vehicle's turret. Use [-1] for driver turret, [] for default primary gunner turret
weapon
args.desc: unit's weapon. Use "" for current weapon

enableengineartillery.title: enableEngineArtillery
enableengineartillery.description: Enable/disable the artillery engine. This allows the user to use the artillery computer on mortar/artillery, and for AI to use it for indirect fire.

addbackpackcargo.title: addBackpackCargo
addbackpackcargo.description:
Add backpack(s) to the cargo space of vehicle. Classname list of available backpacks is here.
For a list of possible backpacks, see:
*  Arma 2: Operation Arrowhead: Backpacks
*  Arma 3: CfgVehicles Equipment (starting with `B_`)

args.name: vehicle
args.desc: vehicle to add the backpack to

args.name: count
args.desc: number of backpacks to add. Since Arma 3 v2.14, negative count will remove backpacks.

fireattarget.title: fireAtTarget
fireattarget.description: Remotely forces a unit to fire the given weapon. See also BIS_fnc_fire.

returns.desc: true if fired, false if not

addcamshake.title: addCamShake
addcamshake.description: Creates the camera shaking effect, like when you are near an explosion

args.name: power
args.desc: strength of shake (camera movement), practical range is 0 to 20

args.name: frequency
args.desc: frequency of shake, practical range is 0 to 100

enablecamshake.title: enableCamShake
enablecamshake.description:
Allows camera shake effects via addCamShake. If set to false, then a currently active shake effect will stop immediately.
By default, shake effects are enabled, but once they have been disabled by this command, they will have to be enabled first, in order to be visible.

args.name: value
args.desc: if true, shake effects are visible

forcewalk.title: forceWalk
forcewalk.description: Forces unit to walk even if run or sprint is selected.

enableirlasers.title: enableIRLasers
enableirlasers.description: Allows the AI to use IR lasers. Units should be in "Combat" behaviour.

args.name: unitOrGroup: Object or Group - the unit or the group allowed to use IR lasers

enablegunlights.title: enableGunLights
enablegunlights.description: Toggles the target group's gun light(s).

args.name: target: Group or Object - the group forced to use gun lights. If unit is supplied as argument, unit's group is used
state

actionkeysnamesarray.description: Returns a list of button names assigned to the given user action. You can find the action names in config class ControllerSchemes or user action names.

args.name: maxKeys
args.desc: maximum number of keys to return

args.name:
inputDevicePriority: String - result sorted by `inputDevicePriority` with values:
* `"Mouse"`
* `"Keyboard"`
* `"Stick"`
* `"Gamepad"`
* `"Tracker"`
* `"Combo"` (mouse and keyboard combinations)
*  (any controller other than mouse or keyboard)
Other values are considered as: 
* `"Unsorted"`

aimedattarget.title: aimedAtTarget
aimedattarget.description: Returns how good the weapon of the vehicle is aimed at the target.

getelevationoffset.title: getElevationOffset
getelevationoffset.description:
Returns the map elevation offset from [map]/config.cpp.

Returns 0 if there is no elevationOffset defined in the config of the current world.

getbackpackcargo.title: getBackpackCargo
getbackpackcargo.description: Returns all backpack types and count from the cargo space.

getmagazinecargo.title: getMagazineCargo
getmagazinecargo.description: Returns all magazines types and count from the cargo space

getweaponcargo.title: getWeaponCargo
getweaponcargo.description: Returns all weapons types and count from the cargo space

backpackspacefor.title: backpackSpaceFor
backpackspacefor.description: Returns how much space is in backpack for given weapon or magazine

currentmuzzle.title: currentMuzzle
currentmuzzle.description: Returns a unit's current weapon muzzle. Does not work on vehicles.

currentweaponmode.title: currentWeaponMode
currentweaponmode.description: Returns current weapon mode of unit's weapon.

args.name: muzzleClass
args.desc: (Optional, default currently active muzzle or first that is found) muzzle classname

fadespeech.title: fadeSpeech
fadespeech.description:
Changes the master speech volume smoothly within the given time. The default volume is 1.0. Some of the sounds that play through speech channel are:
*  Tactical Ping sound
* playSound when isSpeech argument is true
* say3D when isSpeech argument is true

isautohoveron.title: isAutoHoverOn
isautohoveron.description: Return true if vehicle has enabled auto hover. (always returns false if the vehicle can't set auto hover)

isforcedwalk.title: isForcedWalk
isforcedwalk.description: Returns true if player is forced to walk with forceWalk.

ismanualfire.title: isManualFire
ismanualfire.description: Returns true if manual fire is on. Manual fire could either be selected in vehicle action menu (if available) or with action "ManualFire" and "ManualFireCancel". Always returns false for a soldier.

iswalking.title: isWalking
iswalking.description: Returns true if walk is toggled (default W+S in ).

lasertarget.title: laserTarget
lasertarget.description: Returns the laser target object created by given unit (vehicle or soldier) when using a laser targeting device. The main syntax targets the primary gunner turret.

returns.desc: laser target or objNull if no laser target exists
laser target or objNull if no laser target exists

resetcamshake.title: resetCamShake
resetcamshake.description: Stops any ongoing camera shake effects. Does not prevent new effects from being created. To disallow new effects altogether, enableCamShake should be used.

scoreside.title: scoreSide
scoreside.description: Returns score for the given side. MP Only.

syntaxes.code: setCamShakeDefParams [power, duration, frequency, minSpeed, minMass, caliberCoefHit, vehicleCoef]

sendudpmessage.title: sendUDPMessage
sendudpmessage.description: Send message to given address using UDP protocol. Returns false if the message has not been delivered

setcamshakeparams.title: setCamShakeParams
setcamshakeparams.description: Sets camera shake parameters. Will not have any effect until shake is started via addCamShake.

args.name: posCoef
args.desc: strength of positional movement (how far the whole position can change in X,Y&Z). Should not be bigger than 0.1 to prevent the camera from moving into or behind the player

args.name: vertCoef
args.desc: strength of vertical camera pan (up/down), practical range: 0..10

args.name: horzCoef
args.desc: strength of horizontal camera pan (left/right), practical range: 0..10

args.name: bankCoef
args.desc: strength of camera tilt/bank, practical range: 0..20

args.name: interpolation
args.desc: if true, then transitions in the different shaking directions will be smoother

setcamuseti.title: setCamUseTI
setcamuseti.description: Sets thermal vision mode for currently used camera. This command only works with camCreate created camera that is currently the main camera for the player (see Example 2).

args.name: state
args.desc: true to enable, false to disable the effect

args.name:
modeIndex: Number - TI mode. Can be:
* 0 - White Hot
* 1 - Black Hot
* 2 - Light Green Hot / Darker Green cold
* 3 - Black Hot / Darker Green cold
* 4 - Light Red Hot /Darker Red Cold
* 5 - Black Hot / Darker Red Cold
* 6 - White Hot . Darker Red Cold
* 7 - Thermal (Shade of Red and Green, Bodies are white)

setvehicletipars.title: setVehicleTIPars
setvehicletipars.description:
Sets the "heat" state of different vehicle parts for Thermal Imaging detection.
This allows simulation of heated up parts of a vehicle without it actually having to utilize them - on a 0..1 range - 0 being cold, 1 being hot.

setvelocitytransformation.title: setVelocityTransformation
setvelocitytransformation.description:
File:setVelocityTransformation.jpg
Interpolates and applies PositionASL, velocity, vectorDir and vectorUp to the given object based on the interval value.

When interval is 0 the "fromXXX" values are used for the beginning of the interpolation. When interval is 1, the "toXXX" values are used for the end of interpolation.
When interval value is in between, interpolated values are used (see diagram below). The interpolation is linear and along straight line between "from" and "to" positions.
If curve is needed, then it should be constructed from multiple straight sections or by dynamically changing value of position params during the interpolation cycle, similar to  (see ).

The velocity param does not do much in SP, but in MP, provided the velocity component is set correctly, it helps the engine to figure out what the next position of the moving object should be on other clients.
The actual approximate interpolation formula for this command is:
_vecCurrent = _vecFrom vectorAdd (_vecTo vectorDiff _vecFrom vectorMultiply _interval);

syntaxes.code: object setVelocityTransformation [fromPosASL, toPosASL, fromVelocity, toVelocity, fromVectorDir, toVectorDir, fromVectorUp, toVectorUp, interval, customCenter]

args.name: fromPosASL: Array format PositionASL - starting getPosASL of the object
toPosASL: Array format PositionASL - ending getPosASL of the object
interval
args.desc: interpolation interval (variable value, normally between 0 and 1)

args.name: customCenter
args.desc: (Optional, default placing point of the model (see getModelInfo)) custom center [x, y, z] to which transformation would be applied in model coordinates

addmpeventhandler.title: addMPEventHandler
addmpeventhandler.description: Adds a multiplayer event handler (EH) to the given object and returns EH handle. See .

args.name:
expression: String or Code - expression to execute.
If EH has some data to return upon event (e.g. the "MPKilled" EH will return an array with 2 elements: the killed unit, and the killer), it is passed in `_this` variable.

* Event Handler parameters are accessible via  inline_this
* The Event Handler type is available as  inline_thisEvent
* The Event Handler index is available as  inline_thisEventHandler

removempeventhandler.title: removeMPEventHandler
removempeventhandler.description: Removes MP event handler added by addMPEventHandler.

removeallmpeventhandlers.title: removeAllMPEventHandlers
removeallmpeventhandlers.description: Removes all MP event handlers of the given type which were added by addMPEventHandler. Command needs to be executed only on one PC for MP event handler to be removed globally.

getterrainheightasl.title: getTerrainHeightASL
getterrainheightasl.description: Returns the terrain height above the sea for the given position.

args.name: position: Array in format Position2D or Position3D (in which case the Z value is ignored)

getresolution.title: getResolution
getresolution.description: Returns an array containing all information about current client screen resolution.

hostmission.title: hostMission
hostmission.description: Host the multiplayer mission defined in the config class and opens the lobby with the scenario loaded. Must be called in UI action from a dialog.

alldead.title: allDead
alldead.description: Return a list of all dead units including agents and destroyed vehicles. Dead units may be in vehicles.

allmissionobjects.title: allMissionObjects
allmissionobjects.description:
Returns all objects of the given type that are currently present in the mission. In some cases, the entities command is a much faster alternative to this command.
Some of the special types that can be detected with this command (and with nearestObject):
* `""` - returns everything, e.g. agents, bees, mosquitoes, footprints, armed mines, ...
* `"all"` - more restrictive than `""`: no ambient insects, only agents such as rabbits and snakes, no footprints, tracks, no armed mines
* `"#slop"` - blood drops
* `"#mark"` - unit footprints
* `"#track"` - vehicle tracks
* `"#crater"` - explosion craters on the ground
* `"#crateronvehicle"` - bullet marks on vehicles
* `"#explosion"` - explosions
* `"#objectdestructed"` - building, tree or bush destruction
* `"#soundonvehicle"` - sounds created with say3D for example
* `"#dynamicsound"` - sound sources created using createSoundSource
* `"EmptyDetector"` - all Triggers
* `"Logic"` - all game logics

setplayerrespawntime.title: setPlayerRespawnTime
setplayerrespawntime.description: Sets the time interval (in seconds) that the player must wait before respawn. It resets to mission default on mission start. In Single Player or when respawn type is GROUP or SIDE in Multiplayer, setting player respawn time has no effect, and playerRespawnTime will always return -1.

setwaypointvisible.title: setWaypointVisible
setwaypointvisible.description: Sets the visibility of the given waypoint in 3D HUD view (for map visibility see showWaypoint).

setsimpletasktarget.title: setSimpleTaskTarget
setsimpletasktarget.description: Attach a target to the simple task.Overrides setSimpleTaskDestination.

args.name: precisePosition
args.desc: use exact position of the target for map marker / HUD indicator instead of the position known to the owner of the task (depending on the knowledge about the target)

clearbackpackcargoglobal.title: clearBackpackCargoGlobal
clearbackpackcargoglobal.description: Removes all backpacks from the vehicle cargo space. MP synchronized.

clearmagazinecargoglobal.title: clearMagazineCargoGlobal
clearmagazinecargoglobal.description: Removes all magazines from the vehicle cargo space. MP synchronized.

clearweaponcargoglobal.title: clearWeaponCargoGlobal
clearweaponcargoglobal.description: Removes all weapons from the vehicle cargo space. MP synchronized.

weaponstate.title: weaponState
weaponstate.description:
Returns the given or currently selected weapon state for unit or vehicle.
With , if no optional arguments are present, currently selected weapon is queried.

addbackpackcargoglobal.title: addBackpackCargoGlobal
addbackpackcargoglobal.description: Add backpack(s) to the cargo space of vehicle.

args.name: vehicle
args.desc: object to add the Backpack to

args.name: packClassName
args.desc: see the topic :Category:Weapons for reference about possible values.

args.name: count
args.desc: number of backpacks to add;  a negative value will remove backpacks.

assignedteam.title: assignedTeam
assignedteam.description:
Returns the team the unit belongs to. Possible values:

* `"MAIN"` (default and white)
* `"RED"`
* `"GREEN"`
* `"BLUE"`
* `"YELLOW"`
*  `""` if given unit is objNull or remoteControlling another unit

syntaxes.code: ropeCreate [fromObject, fromPoint, toObject, toPoint, segments, length]

args.name: fromObject
args.desc: object where rope starts and which fly behavior will be affected

args.name: fromPoint: Array or String - specifies where on the object the rope should start, either a string (name of memory point) or an array of three numbers (vector in model coordinates).
toObject
args.desc: object which is automatically attached to other side of rope (can be objNull, rope will stay with free end)

args.name: toPoint: Array or String - specifies where on the object the rope should finish, either a string (name of memory point) or an array of three numbers (vector in model coordinates)
segments
args.desc: define number of segments to be created

syntaxes.code: ropeCreate [fromObject, fromPoint, length, segments, unroll, ropeType]

args.name: fromObject
args.desc: object where rope starts and which fly behavior will be affected

args.name: fromPoint: Array or String - specifies where on the object the rope should start, either a string (name of memory point) or an array of three numbers (vector in model coordinates)
unroll
args.desc: (Optional, default false) true if rope starts at one place and falls down unrolling itself, false to create it already in full length

args.name: position: Array format Position2D or Position3D - when using Position3D, Z is ignored

allowcrewinimmobile.title: allowCrewInImmobile
allowcrewinimmobile.description:
If true, units will remain in a vehicle with broken tracks/wheels; they will still eject if the vehicle is drowning, about to explode or upside down for a while.
The  provides the ability to keep the crew in vehicle when it is upside down.

args.name: brokenWheels
args.desc: do not auto eject when vehicle has broken wheels

args.name: upsideDown
args.desc: do not auto eject when vehicle is upside down

visibleposition.title: visiblePosition
visibleposition.description: Returns an object's rendered position (z value above surface underneath) in render time scope. Same as getPosVisual.

callextension.title: callExtension
callextension.description:
Calls custom .dll also known as Extension. The name of the extension is the name of the extension .dll without ".dll" part (or without "_x64.dll" part on 64-bit Arma). For example if the file is 'myExtension.dll' the name of the extension will be "myExtension". For 64-bit extensions, the name of the extension doesn't need to change and is still "myExtension". The game will automatically look for 'myExtension_x64.dll' when you use 64-bit Arma exe.

This command is blocking, meaning that the game will wait for the extension to return before continuing. This may cause FPS drop if extension is not optimised. If extension takes too long, consider making asynchronous extension, where the result of the work of the extension is collected in a separate call.

Currently there is no limit how much data you can send to the extension. However there is a limit on how much data you can return from extension in one call. The limit is known to the extension and is passed in ` int outputSize`. The limit may or may not change in the future and is currently 10240 bytes. It is up to extension designer to handle multipart results if returned data exceeds output limit.

Since Arma 3 v1.67 it is possible to pass array of arguments to extensions. The array of arguments could be anything and all elements will be converted to strings, however you might want to only send simple types like Booleans, Strings, Numbers and Arrays of all of the above. There is currently a limit on how many arguments can be sent and it is 2048 (since Arma 3 v1.92; previous limit: 1024). However an argument could be an Array itself, in this case extension maker will have to provide additional methods for parsing such arguments.

Possible error codes:
* 101: SYNTAX_ERROR_WRONG_PARAMS_SIZE
* 102: SYNTAX_ERROR_WRONG_PARAMS_TYPE
* 201: PARAMS_ERROR_TOO_MANY_ARGS
* 301: EXECUTION_WARNING_TAKES_TOO_LONG
Each error will have entry in .rpt file with more details.

The extension execution timeout, after which `301: EXECUTION_WARNING_TAKES_TOO_LONG` warning is issued, is hardcoded on clients and is 1000.0 milliseconds (1 second). On the server the default limit is also 1 second, however it is possible to set custom limit with `callExtReportLimit` param (see  Server Options).

If an extension with the given name can't be found (or it is found but doesn't implement the required interface properly / at all) the following error will be written into the RPT (In this example the given dll-name was "MyExtension"):
 styledisplay: block14:27:07 CallExtension 'MyExtension' could not be found

If an extension is not whitelisted with BattlEye (see Extensions for more info) it will be blocked on clients running with enabled BattlEye protection. RPT message outputted however is a little obscure:
 styledisplay: block21:35:04 Call extension 'MyExtension' could not be loaded: Insufficient system resources exist to complete the requested service

Since Arma 3 v1.69, `RVExtensionVersion` interface (see source code example below) has been added, which is called by the engine on extension load and expects extension version. This interface is designed to work with both, Linux and Windows. The max buffer size is 32 bytes. The version information will then appear in .rpt file like so:
 styledisplay: block19:06:36 CallExtension loaded: test_extension (.\test_extension.dll) [1.0.0.1]

For more information see Extensions.

Linux specific
While on Windows the extension name is case-insensitive, on Linux the extension name is case-sensitive and should match the name of the .so file exactly (minus ".so" part).




Extension Callback

Since Arma 3 v1.95 it is possible to call the game directly from the extension via function pointer provided when extension is called for the first time (assuming the extension implements at least one of the `RVExtension` or `RVExtensionArgs` methods). The function pointer passed over to `RVExtensionRegisterCallback` method is of the following signature (see Example 4):
 langcppint(*callbackProc)(char const *name, char const *function, char const *data)
Calling this function pointer from extension will trigger  "ExtensionCallback" mission event handler with 3 user supplied params. The params are
* `name` - make it unique name, for example the extension name, so that other modders can quickly filter out calls from own extensions
* `function` - make it name of the function the extension sends the result to. (Note: The returned function is just a STRING! So compile is needed, before using call or spawn, to execute it)
* `data` - make it the actual result. You can also format it as an array so it could be parsed by parseSimpleArray
Calling function pointer returns an `int`. This is the number of available slots in the input buffer left for this frame after your call and can range from 99 to -1. The buffer is processed and cleared every frame and the maximum number of slots that can be filled per frame is 100. If you are planning to call back with more than 100 results per frame, make sure your extension retries if it receives negative `int`, which means the buffer was full and your call did not succeed. Ideally suited for callbacks from different threads, but if callback is initiated from the calling thread, the EH will fire on the next frame of game simulation. Needless to say, the "ExtensionCallback" event handler needs to exist before any callbacks, otherwise the data will just stay in the buffer. Removing all "ExtensionCallback" EHs clears the buffer as well as mission restart.

Extension Context

Since Arma 3 v2.11 the engine will call `RVExtensionContext` method (if exists, see Example 5) and pass the following data:
* `steamID` of the client calling extension getPlayerUID or "0"
* `fileSource` from which the extension was executed or "" if done on the fly
* `missionName` missionNameSource
* `serverName` serverName

returns.desc: data sent back from extension; If the extensiion was not found an empty String will be returned

args.name: arguments
args.desc: function arguments. Could be array of Anything, each element will be converted to String automatically. Current allowed max length of this array is 2048 (since Arma 3 v1.92; previous limit: 1024)

setweaponreloadingtime.title: setWeaponReloadingTime
setweaponreloadingtime.description: Sets reloading phase on the given weapon's current ammo round.

args.name: gunner
args.desc: alive and able gunner operating the targeted turret

args.name: reloadTime
args.desc: in range 0..1 where 0: reload complete, 1: reload started

returns.desc: true if given weapon is found

uisleep.title: uiSleep
uisleep.description:
Suspend execution of script for given UI time. uiSleep is a sleep method to delay script execution where script time/simulation time is stopped.
uiSleep is basically using the system time (uiTime more specifically) and not simulation time.
So in the cases where sleep would get stuck indefinitely, uiSleep can still be used to effectively delay script execution for example in pause or in a mission briefing or an editor or when simulation is paused in general.

terrainintersect.title: terrainIntersect
terrainintersect.description: Checks for intersection of terrain between two AGL positions. Returns true if intersects with terrain. For ASL variant see terrainIntersectASL.

args.name: start: Array format PositionAGL - start position
end: Array format PositionAGL - end position

lineintersects.title: lineIntersects
lineintersects.description: Checks for object intersection with a virtual line between two positions.

args.name: objIgnore1
args.desc: (Optional, default objNull) object to ignore. When testing intersection from an object/unit/vehicle, pass that object here to prevent intersection inside of the object

args.name: objIgnore2
args.desc: (Optional, default objNull) another object to ignore. When testing intersection of a line between two objects, pass the second object here to prevent intersection inside of it being reported

returns.desc: true if an intersection happens with an object (not with terrain)

lineintersectswith.title: lineIntersectsWith
lineintersectswith.description: Returns objects intersecting with the virtual line from begPos to endPos. By default, the resulting array of intersecting objects is unsorted (see sortByDistance).

args.name: begPos: Array format PositionASL - virtual line start
endPos: Array format PositionASL - virtual line end
objIgnore1
args.desc: (Optional) object to ignore. When testing intersection from an object/unit/vehicle, pass that object here to prevent intersection inside of the object.

args.name: objIgnore2
args.desc: (Optional) another object to ignore. When testing intersection of a line between two objects, pass the second object here to prevent intersection inside of it being reported

args.name: sortByDistance
args.desc: (Optional) true: sort by descending distance (furthermost object first, closest object last); false: unsorted

setunitrecoilcoefficient.title: setUnitRecoilCoefficient
setunitrecoilcoefficient.description: Proportionaly increase/decrease unit's recoil. Drives muzzle up with every shot when supplied positive number and down when negative. 0 cancels recoil.

unitrecoilcoefficient.title: unitRecoilCoefficient
unitrecoilcoefficient.description: Returns recoil coefficient of a soldier.

terrainintersectasl.title: terrainIntersectASL
terrainintersectasl.description:
Checks for intersection of terrain between two ASL positions. Returns true if intersects with terrain.
For AGL variant, see terrainIntersect.

args.name: start: Array format PositionASL - start position
end: Array format PositionASL - end position

moonintensity.title: moonIntensity
moonintensity.description: Returns the intensity of the moon's brightness in range 0...1.

sunormoon.title: sunOrMoon
sunormoon.description:
{! classwikitable float-right align-center-col-1 stylefont-size: 0.85em; min-width: 15em
! Time
! sunOrMoon
!-
! 12:00
! 1
!-
! (...)
! 1
!-
! 18:39
! 0.911201
!-
! 18:42
! 0.576303
!-
! 18:45
! 0.240862
!-
! 18:48
! 0
!-
! (...)
! 0
!-
! 06:00
! 0.695308
!-
! 06:03
! 0.739519
!-
! 06:09
! 1
!-
! (...)
! 1
!}
Returns the moon to sun transition state in range 0..1.
The return value is either 0 or 1 most of the time, the in-between values only returned during a few minutes in the morning and in the evening, depending on the date, and could be similar to shown here:

 modepackedFile:sunOrMoon VR up.png200Sunrise in  VRFile:sunOrMoon VR down.png200Sunset in  VR

setowner.title: setOwner
setowner.description: From server machine, change the ownership of an object to a given client. Using command in an unintended way will log a message to .rpt file. To transfer ownership of all AI units in a group properly, use setGroupOwner instead.

args.name: clientID
args.desc: the  machine network ID of the new owner.

returns.desc: returns true if ownership was successfully transferred, otherwise false

settonemapping.title: setToneMapping
settonemapping.description: Applies a specific tone mapping to the game. The tone mapping can be edited with setToneMappingParams.

args.name:
toneName: String - can be one of:
* "Arma"
* "Filmic"
* "Reinhard"

settonemappingparams.title: setToneMappingParams
settonemappingparams.description: Edits tone mapping parameters. Settings are stored even if the concerned tone is not the one currently in use.

args.name:
toneName: String - can be one of:
* "Arma"
* "Filmic"
* "Reinhard"

params: Array of Numbers
* "Arma" - no parameters
* "Filmic" - format [shoulderStrength, linearStrength, linearAngle, toeStrength, toeNumerator, toeDenominator, linearWhite, exposureBias]
* "Reinhard" - format [linearWhite, saturation]

productversion.title: productVersion
productversion.description: Returns the product's friendly name, identifier, version and build number.

librarycredits.title: libraryCredits
librarycredits.description: Returns the credits for the libraries used by the game.

returns.desc: [array1, array2, (..), arrayN] all under the form [libraryName, credits]

eyepos.title: eyePos
eyepos.description: Returns the object's eyes / main turret position.

deactivatekey.title: deActivateKey
deactivatekey.description:
Deactivates the given keyname for the current user profile. The keys are used to unlock missions or campaigns.

See keys, keysLimit and doneKeys in the description.ext file of the missions.

visiblepositionasl.title: visiblePositionASL
visiblepositionasl.description: Returns an object's rendered ASL position (z value above sea level) in render time scope.

aimpos.title: aimPos
aimpos.description: Returns the position of the object other units can aim to.

atltoasl.title: ATLToASL
atltoasl.description: Converts a position from PositionATL to PositionASL

args.name: pos: Array format PositionATL - position to convert

asltoatl.title: ASLToATL
asltoatl.description: Converts a position from PositionASL to PositionATL

args.name: pos: Array format PositionASL - position to convert

hint.title: hint
hint.description:
Outputs a hint message to the right of the screen (left of the screen in ) with a sound (except in ).
To split message in multiple lines either use Structured Text or `\n` (in lower case).

args.name: message: String or Structured Text - the message to display.

setbehaviour.title: setBehaviour

args.name: groupOrUnit : Group or Object - unit or a group

behaviour: String - can be one of:
* "CARELESS"
* "SAFE"
* "AWARE"
* "COMBAT"
* "STEALTH"

format.title: format
format.description: Composes a string containing other variables or other variable types. Converts any variable type to a string. If you want to convert a string back to a number, use parseNumber.

args.name: formatString
args.desc: a string containing text and/or references to the variables listed below in the array. The references appear in the form of %1, %2 etc.

returns.desc: the full string (up to 8kb, see above) is returned.

select.title: select
select.description: Selects an element from an array, config entry from Config or substring from a string or a range from an array.

args.name:
index: Number - index 0 denotes the first element, 1 the second, etc. If index has decimal places it gets rounded down for fractions less than or equal .5, otherwise it gets rounded up.
 negative index can be used to select from the end of the array, i.e. -1 means last array element.

returns.desc: a reference to the array element given by its index

args.name: boolean
args.desc: false selects the first element of the Array, true the second one

returns.desc: a reference to the array element

args.name: index
args.desc: index 0 denotes the first element, 1 the second, etc. If index has decimal places it gets rounded down for fractions less than or equal .5, otherwise it gets rounded up

args.name: start
args.desc: string position to start selection from. 0 denotes the first character of the string, 1 the second, etc. If passed number has decimal places it gets rounded down for fractions less than or equal .5, otherwise it gets rounded up

args.name: length
args.desc: (Optional, default string's length) number of characters to select

args.name: start
args.desc: array index to start selection from

args.name: count
args.desc: ( Optional) number of array elements to select. If the selected range exceeds source array boundaries, selection will be made up to the last element of the array.

args.name:
expression: Code - expression that is expected to return Boolean or Nothing.
If true is returned, the original array value of currently tested element _x will be added to the output array

returns.desc: a new array of all elements from the original array that satisfied expression condition

random.title: random
random.description:
File:bellcurve.jpg120Syntax 2's distribution
{!
! stylepadding-right: 1em; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap  
! generates a random floating point value
!-
! stylepadding-right: 1em; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap   
! generates a Technically, it is a rescaled  with n = 4. The distribution is split in two at its midpoint and scaled linearly such that its maximum lies at the specified midpoint.. It uses the same method as setTriggerTimeout command and is quite useful for e.g spawning loot, making more valuable items more rare
!-
! stylepadding-right: 1em; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap   
! generates a  random number
!-
! stylepadding-right: 1em; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap   
! generates a  random noise (not Perlin) texture based on provided seed and returning the value at supplied coordinates
!}

args.name: seed
args.desc: an integer. Any float value will be truncated (e.g -0.9, -0.1, 0.1 or 0.9 will be read as 0)

damage.title: damage
damage.description: Return the damage value of an object.

player.title: player
player.description: A person object controlled by user. In Intros and Outros this isn't set by default and must be assigned.

position.title: position
position.description: Returns position of an object (alias of getPos) or location (alias of locationPosition).

objnull.title: objNull
objnull.description:
A non-existent Object. To compare non-existent objects use isNull or isEqualTo:

objNull == objNull;			// false
isNull objNull;				// true
objNull isEqualTo objNull;	// true

east.title: east
east.description: Pre-defined variable for the eastern side.

addrating.title: addRating
addrating.description:
Add a number to the rating of a unit - negative values can be used to reduce the rating.
This command is usually used to reward for completed mission objectives. The rating is given at the end of the mission and is automatically adjusted when killing enemies or friendlies. 

When the rating gets below -2000, the unit's side switches to "ENEMY" (sideEnemy) and the unit is attacked by everyone.(see Rating Values)

See also: Arma_3:_Event_Handlers#HandleRating

abs.title: abs
abs.description: Returns absolute (positive) value of a real number.

count.title: count
count.description:
Can be used to count:
* The number of elements in an array (returns the already internally known array size)
* The number of elements in an array matching the condition
* The number of sub-entries in a config entry
*  The number of characters in an ANSI string

args.name: value: Array, String, Config or HashMap
condition
args.desc: condition that must return true for the tested element to be counted. The variable `_x` will contain the currently tested element

publicvariableserver.title: publicVariableServer
publicvariableserver.description: Send the variable value to the server - same limitations regarding variable type as publicVariable.

publicvariableclient.title: publicVariableClient
publicvariableclient.description:
Send the variable value to the client computer - same limitations regarding variable type as publicVariable.

The Client ID is the temporary ID given to a connected client for that session. You can find out this ID with the owner command (using it on a player's character, for example, will give you that players client ID).

profilenamespace.title: profileNamespace
profilenamespace.description:
Returns the global namespace attached to the active user profile. Use setVariable and getVariable to save and load data to and from this Namespace. A variable can be deleted by setting its value to nil. By default the variables set in this namespace will exist while the game is running, and variables are saved persistently when the game is closed. Saving can also be forced by using saveProfileNamespace to prevent data loss on e.g game crash.
The variables are stored next to the user profile in a file named `myUsername.vars.GAMENAME`.

saveprofilenamespace.title: saveProfileNamespace
saveprofilenamespace.description: Saves all variables stored in profileNamespace to the active Profile.

oneachframe.title: onEachFrame
oneachframe.description: Runs given statement every frame in an unscheduled environment.

hasinterface.title: hasInterface
hasinterface.description: Returns true if the computer has an interface (a real player). False for a dedicated server or for a headless client.

addgoggles.title: addGoggles
addgoggles.description: Create a new item and try to link it into goggles (glasses) slot.

addhandgunitem.title: addHandgunItem
addhandgunitem.description: Adds weapon item, including magazine, directly to the handgunWeapon. This is used for infantry weapons.

addheadgear.title: addHeadgear
addheadgear.description: Creates a headgear item and tries to link it to headgear slot. If slot is occupied with another item, the item in the slot will be replaced.

additem.title: addItem
additem.description: Creates new item and tries to add it into inventory. Inventory must have enough space to accomodate new item or command will fail.The item can also be a weapon or a magazine.

additemcargo.title: addItemCargo
additemcargo.description:
Creates new items and stores them in given container.
Works with items, weapons, magazines, equipment and glasses but not backpacks.
In the latter case use addBackpackCargo instead. For the global variant, see addItemCargoGlobal.

args.name: count
args.desc: number of items to add;  a negative value removes items

args.name: count
args.desc: number of items to add. Since Arma 3 v2.14, negative count will remove items.

addmagazines.title: addMagazines
addmagazines.description: Adds multiple magazines to the unit. For cargo containers use addMagazineCargoGlobal command.

addprimaryweaponitem.title: addPrimaryWeaponItem
addprimaryweaponitem.description: Adds weapon item, including magazine, directly to the primaryWeapon. This is used for infantry weapons.

addsecondaryweaponitem.title: addSecondaryWeaponItem
addsecondaryweaponitem.description: Adds weapon item, including magazine, directly to the secondaryWeapon. This is used for infantry weapons.

adduniform.title: addUniform
adduniform.description: Create a new uniform and try to link it into uniform slot (given uniform has to be supported by allowedUniforms list of target soldier).

addvest.title: addVest
addvest.description: Create a new vest and try to link it into vest slot.

alldeadmen.title: allDeadMen
alldeadmen.description: Return a list of dead units including agents. Dead unit might be inside vehicle.

allmapmarkers.title: allMapMarkers
allmapmarkers.description:
Returns all markers in map including user placed markers (_USER_DEFINED #). 
Since Arma 3 v1.58 User defined markers have the following name format: `_USER_DEFINED #<PlayerID>/<MarkerID>/<ChannelID>` where:
* <PlayerID> - unique network id of the player in String format, also available as String in the 6th param in  "PlayerConnected" and "PlayerDisconnected" Event Handlers
* <MarkerID> - a marker counter id
* <ChannelID> - id of the chat channel on which marker was placed (see currentChannel)

assigneditems.title: assignedItems
assigneditems.description: Get array with assigned items. The resulting Array order is not guaranteed. To check availability of a particular slot item use getSlotItemName. To return stored items see items and itemsWithMagazines.

args.name: allItems
args.desc: true to include all slot items, false exclude goggles and headgear

args.name: includeBinocs
args.desc: true to include binoculars (which is a weapon), false to exclude it

assignitem.title: assignItem
assignitem.description: Assigns existing item from inventory (uniform, vest, backpack) to a correct slot. If the slot is occupied by another item, it gets replaced. See also linkItem.

backpack.title: backpack
backpack.description: Returns a class of a backpack.

backpackcargo.title: backpackCargo
backpackcargo.description: Get array with backpacks from ammo box (or any general weapon holder container).

backpackitems.title: backpackItems
backpackitems.description: Get array with all items (of any kind, even weapons) in backpack of the given unit.

clearallitemsfrombackpack.title: clearAllItemsFromBackpack
clearallitemsfrombackpack.description: Removes all items from backpack of a unit.

clearbackpackcargo.title: clearBackpackCargo
clearbackpackcargo.description: Removes all backpacks from ammo box (or any general weapon holder container).

clearitemcargo.title: clearItemCargo
clearitemcargo.description: Removes all items from ammo box (or any general weapon holder container).

clearitemcargoglobal.title: clearItemCargoGlobal
clearitemcargoglobal.description: Removes all items from ammo box (or any general weapon holder container). It also removes vests and uniforms.

customchat.title: customChat
customchat.description: Sends the chat message to the custom radio channel. The radio channel needs to be created on the server before hand, with radioChannelCreate command.

args.name: customChannelID
args.desc: Custom channel ID returned by radioChannelCreate command

customradio.title: customRadio
customradio.description: Sends the message to the custom radio channel. The message is defined in the description.ext file or radio protocol.

args.name: customChannelID
args.desc: custom channel ID returned by radioChannelCreate command

disablecollisionwith.title: disableCollisionWith
disablecollisionwith.description: Disable collision between provided objects. The collision is always disabled for both objects in the arguments.

enablecollisionwith.title: enableCollisionWith
enablecollisionwith.description: Cancels the effects of disableCollisionWith. The collision is always enabled for both objects in the arguments, i.e. vehicle1 with vehicle2 and vehicle2 with vehicle1

enablecopilot.title: enableCopilot
enablecopilot.description: Enables copilot actions, toggles availability of the actions related to copilots, such as taking over controls, suspending controls, etc. This command triggers the `"ControlsShifted"` event handler.

args.name: vehicle
args.desc: vehicle on which to toggle copilot actions

forceweaponfire.title: forceWeaponFire
forceweaponfire.description: The unit will be forced to fire weapon from the given muzzle. The weapon will not fire if firemode passed as parameter is not supported by the given muzzle. The muzzle could belong to a vehicle weapon and unit in this case will be the unit operating this weapon. Doesnt't seem to work for units in FFV positions. Works on player. See also: BIS_fnc_fire

args.name:
firemode: String - common options are "Single", "Burst", "FullAuto". For the full list of a weapon firemodes:

hint str (getArray (configFile >> "CfgWeapons" >> currentWeapon player >> "modes")); If modes[] param in config for the weapon says {"this"}, then the same classname as for the weapon param (currentWeapon player) should be used as firemode param.

freelook.title: freeLook
freelook.description: Returns if freelook is active on the current machine's controlled character.

returns.desc: true if freelook is active, false otherwise

getartillerycomputersettings.title: getArtilleryComputerSettings
getartillerycomputersettings.description: Returns settings from artillery computer currently opened by player.

getitemcargo.title: getItemCargo
getitemcargo.description: Returns all items names and count from ammo box (or any general weapon holder container).

goggles.title: goggles
goggles.description: Returns name of currently used goggles (for NVGoggles use hmd).

groupfromnetid.title: groupFromNetId
groupfromnetid.description: Get group with given unique ID. For objects use objectFromNetId. As this command is MP only, you can use BIS_fnc_groupFromNetId, which extends the use to SP as well.

gusts.title: gusts
gusts.description: Return the current gusts value. Scale is 0 to 1.

handgunitems.title: handgunItems
handgunitems.description: Returns array with all items assigned to the handgunWeapon except magazines. Use handgunMagazine command for the latter. This command is used for infantry weapons only.

humidity.title: humidity
humidity.description: Returns the current humidity value. 0 is no humidity and 1 is 100% humidity. Humidity value quickly changes from 0 to 1 when rain starts, then slowly changes from 1 to 0 when rain stops.

inrangeofartillery.title: inRangeOfArtillery
inrangeofartillery.description: Returns true if all given units are able to fire at given position with given magazineType.

args.name: units: Array of Objects - array of units.

iscopilotenabled.title: isCopilotEnabled
iscopilotenabled.description: Returns true if copilots actions are enabled.

isflashlighton.title: isFlashlightOn
isflashlighton.description: Returns true if there is a linked and enabled flashlight on a given weapon.

isirlaseron.title: isIRLaserOn
isirlaseron.description: Returns true if there is a linked and enabled IR on the given weapon.

istouchingground.title: isTouchingGround
istouchingground.description: Returns true if object is touching the ground.

itemcargo.title: itemCargo
itemcargo.description: Get array with items from ammo box (or any general weapon holder container).

returns.desc: see supported languages for possible values

linkitem.title: linkItem
linkitem.description: Create and assign item to the correct slot. If there is an item in the targeted slot, it gets replaced. See also assignItem.

load.title: load
load.description: Returns the percentage of fullness of a unit's cargo. Output is usually in range 0..1, but can be higher after using certain scripting commands (like addWeaponWithAttachmentsCargoGlobal) which ignore load values when adding items.

args.name: unit
args.desc: (before  the command did not support containers, ammo boxes, weapon holders, vehicle cargos)

loadabs.title: loadAbs
loadabs.description: Returns current sum of mass from items stored in all unit's containers, linked items and weapons.

args.name: unit
args.desc: (before  the command did not support containers, ammo boxes, weapon holders, vehicle cargos)

loadbackpack.title: loadBackpack

loaduniform.title: loadUniform

loadvest.title: loadVest

magazinecargo.title: magazineCargo
magazinecargo.description: Get array with magazines from ammo box (or any general weapon holder container).

magazinesdetail.title: magazinesDetail
magazinesdetail.description:
Returns an array of strings with description of all vehicle's magazines, their ammo count (current/default) and their ids for the primary gunner. 

When applied to a unit (soldier), the command behaves differently and will omit magazines already loaded into unit's weapons. Use currentMagazineDetail to get this information for a currently loaded magazine.

args.name: includeEmpty
args.desc: (Optional, default false) true to include empty magazines

args.name: includeLoaded
args.desc: (Optional, default false) true to include magazines loaded in weapons (Since Arma 3 v2.07.148195)

mineactive.title: mineActive
mineactive.description: Checks if the given mine is active.

netid.title: netId
netid.description: Unique ID of object or group.  As this command is MP only, you can use BIS_fnc_netId, which extends the use to SP as well. See also: BIS_fnc_objectVar

objectfromnetid.title: objectFromNetId
objectfromnetid.description: Get object with given unique ID. If object is a group use groupFromNetId. As this command is MP only, you can use BIS_fnc_objectFromNetId, which extends the use to SP as well.

particlesquality.title: particlesQuality
particlesquality.description: Returns current user settings for particles quality (configure->video->general->particles). 0-low, 1-normal, 2-high

ppeffectforceinnvg.title: ppEffectForceInNVG
ppeffectforceinnvg.description: Forces use of Post Process Effects in NVG.

args.name: ppHandle
args.desc: handle of the post processing returned by ppEffectCreate

primaryweaponitems.title: primaryWeaponItems
primaryweaponitems.description: Returns array with all items assigned to the primaryWeapon except magazines. Use primaryWeaponMagazine command for the latter. This command is used for infantry weapons only.

profilename.title: profileName
profilename.description: Returns currently chosen user profile name. For Steam profile name see profileNameSteam.

removeallassigneditems.title: removeAllAssignedItems
removeallassigneditems.description:
Unassigns and deletes all linked items from inventory.
The commands operates on assignedItems array, which does not include goggles or headgear but includes binoculars, which is a weapon.
Use removeGoggles and removeHeadgear for those.

args.name: allItems
args.desc: true to include all slot items, false exclude goggles and headgear

args.name: includeBinocs
args.desc: true to include binoculars (which is a weapon), false to exclude it

removeallcontainers.title: removeAllContainers
removeallcontainers.description: Removes all containers (vest, uniform, backpack) from the provided unit.

removegoggles.title: removeGoggles
removegoggles.description: Removes goggles from unit (diver goggles for example). This command does not remove NVGoggles. Use unassignItem and removeItem or just unlinkItem for latter.

removeheadgear.title: removeHeadgear
removeheadgear.description: Removes headgear from a unit. If unit has no headgear command quietly fails.

removeitem.title: removeItem
removeitem.description: Removes item from the inventory. The removal order by containers is uniform → vest → backpack.

removeitems.title: removeItems
removeitems.description: Removes all items with given class name from the inventory.

resetsubgroupdirection.title: resetSubgroupDirection
resetsubgroupdirection.description:
Sets  formation direction of a group relative to current direction of the group leader. The group units will change their positions to form new formation if new formation direction is different (approx +/- 15 degrees). Does the same as:
_grp setFormDir getDir leader _grp;

secondaryweaponitems.title: secondaryWeaponItems
secondaryweaponitems.description: Returns array with all items assigned to the secondaryWeapon except magazines. Use secondaryWeaponMagazine command for the latter. This command is used for infantry weapons only.

setammo.title: setAmmo
setammo.description: Sets custom ammo count in the currently loaded magazine of the specified weapon or muzzle.

args.name: weaponOrMuzzle
args.desc: weapon name. Muzzle name in case the weapon has more than one muzzle, e.g. weapon with grenade launcher. See CfgWeapons for muzzle names

setfatigue.title: setFatigue
setfatigue.description: Sets the person's fatigue, from 0 to 1.

args.name: value
args.desc: in 0..1 available fatigue range: 0 is fully energised, 1 is fully exhausted

setparticleclass.title: setParticleClass
setparticleclass.description: Sets particle source parameters using existing particle config from `CfgCloudlets` class. Use setParticleParams subsequently if you need to overwrite some values.

setuseractiontext.title: setUserActionText
setuseractiontext.description: File:setUserActionText.jpg350 Changes user added action (see addAction) menu item text.

args.name: object
args.desc: object the action is added to

args.name: textMenu: String or Structured Text - text title shown in scroll action menu
textWindowBackground: String or Structured Text - (Optional, default "") background text
textWindowForeground: String or Structured Text - (Optional, default "") foreground text

setvehicleammodef.title: setVehicleAmmoDef
setvehicleammodef.description: Sets how much ammunition (compared to the configuration of magazines defined in the vehicle's class) the vehicle has. Note that the ammo will only be added to local turrets. To check the locality of turret use turretLocal.

shownartillerycomputer.title: shownArtilleryComputer
shownartillerycomputer.description: Checks whether the player has the artillery computer currently open.

stance.title: stance
stance.description: Returns the stance of the given unit.

systemchat.title: systemChat
systemchat.description: Types text to the system radio channel. The text will be visible only on the PC where command was executed. If you need the message to show on all computers, you have to execute it globally (see remoteExec).

unassignitem.title: unassignItem
unassignitem.description: Unassigns existing item and tries to put it into inventory. If there is no space in inventory the item simply disappears. See also unlinkItem.

uniformitems.title: uniformItems
uniformitems.description: Get array with all items (of any kind, even weapons) from uniform.

velocitymodelspace.title: velocityModelSpace
velocitymodelspace.description: Returns the velocity (speed vector) of the vehicle as an array with format [x, y, z] in metre per second. Vector is in model space.

vestitems.title: vestItems
vestitems.description: Get array with all items (of any kind, even weapons) from vest.

weaponaccessories.title: weaponAccessories
weaponaccessories.description: Get array with all items linked to a given weapon.

weaponcargo.title: weaponCargo
weaponcargo.description: Get array with weapons from ammo box (or any general weapon holder container).

currentmagazinedetail.title: currentMagazineDetail
currentmagazinedetail.description: Returns description of vehicle's currently loaded magazine, its ammo count (current/default) and its id.

handgunweapon.title: handgunWeapon
handgunweapon.description: Returns the name of a unit's handgun (an empty string if there is none).

blufor.title: blufor
blufor.description: Pre-defined variable for the blufor side.

opfor.title: opfor
opfor.description: Pre-defined variable for the opfor side.

independent.title: independent
independent.description: Pre-defined variable for the independent side.

setdebriefingtext.title: setDebriefingText
setdebriefingtext.description:
Sets debriefing title, text, subtitle, picture and background for a mission ending. The end type could be the engine-defined ("CONTINUE", "KILLED", "LOSER", "END1", "END2", "END3", "END4", "END5", "END6"), config-defined (see CfgDebriefing) or, with an alternative syntax of this command, any String. Given texts will be used to replace the corresponding texts on the debriefing screen. 


File:endMission.jpg400 File:failMission.jpg400

args.name: title
args.desc: title text on the debriefing screen

args.name: description
args.desc: description text on the debriefing screen

syntaxes.code: endType setDebriefingText [title, description, subtitle, picture, background]

args.name: title
args.desc: title text on the debriefing screen

args.name: description
args.desc: description text on the debriefing screen

args.name: subtitle
args.desc: subtitle text on the debriefing screen (Must be set to use this syntax, even if to empty string "")

swimindepth.title: swimInDepth
swimindepth.description: Sets the target depth level for swimming soldier. Depth should be a negative number.

setbleedingremaining.title: setBleedingRemaining
setbleedingremaining.description:
Sets for how many seconds injured unit leaves blood trail.
The unit damage must be >= 0.1 for this command to have an effect, otherwise, the getBleedingRemaining will return 0 and no blood trail is left behind.

setoxygenremaining.title: setOxygenRemaining
setoxygenremaining.description: Sets oxygen remaining. It has no effect when soldier is not diving. Oxygen remaining is a number between 0 and 1.

setwindstr.title: setWindStr
setwindstr.description: Changes the wind strength smoothly during the given time (in seconds). A time of zero means there will be an immediate change.

setgusts.title: setGusts
setgusts.description: Changes the gusts value smoothly during the given time (in seconds). A time of zero means there will be an immediate change. Value is 0 to 1.

setlightnings.title: setLightnings
setlightnings.description:
Changes the lightnings value smoothly during the given time (in seconds). A time of zero means there will be an immediate change.
NOTE: This command will have no effect (even though the value of lightnings changes) unless `Manual Override` option is selected in the editor in the Intel, which is normally off.
File:setLightnings.jpg600

setwaves.title: setWaves
setwaves.description:
Changes the waves value smoothly during the given time (in seconds). A time of zero means there will be an immediate change.
NOTE: This command will have no effect (even though the value of waves changes) unless `Manual Override` option is selected in the editor in the Intel, which is normally off.
File:setWaves.jpg600

setrainbow.title: setRainbow
setrainbow.description: Changes the rainbow value smoothly during the given time (in seconds). A time of zero means there will be an immediate change.

setlightattenuation.title: setLightAttenuation
setlightattenuation.description:
Sets attenuation of light. Standard method of attenuation (1 / (constant + linear*dist + quadratic*dist*dist)).
start param represents distance where the attenuation starts to take effects (dist = distance - start).

syntaxes.code: light setLightAttenuation [start, constant, linear, quadratic, hardlimitstart, hardlimitend]

args.name: start
args.desc: distance with 100% intensity, falloff starts here

args.name: hardlimitstart
args.desc: (Optional) max distance hard limit start (start of fading of intensity to 0) in m

args.name: hardlimitend
args.desc: (Optional) max distance hard limit end (end of fading of intensity to 0) in m

setlightdaylight.title: setLightDayLight
setlightdaylight.description: Sets if light can be used during the day.

setlightflaresize.title: setLightFlareSize
setlightflaresize.description: Sets relative size of the flare for the light.

setlightflaremaxdistance.title: setLightFlareMaxDistance
setlightflaremaxdistance.description: Sets max distance where the flare is visible.

revealmine.title: revealMine
revealmine.description: Sets given mine as known to the side. (Knowledge about a mine is always shared across all units in a side.)

isbleeding.title: isBleeding
isbleeding.description: Returns whether the unit is bleeding.

isburning.title: isBurning
isburning.description:
Returns whether the unit is burning.
This returns true only if unit is damaged by nearby fire, it does not check whether a fireplace is burning, use inflamed command for that.

isabletobreathe.title: isAbleToBreathe
isabletobreathe.description: If unit is diving and doesn't have a re-breather, it returns false. Diving means the unit's head is underwater. If unit is underwater and has a re-breather, the command returns true.

underwater.title: underwater
underwater.description: Returns whether the object is fully underwater.

getburningvalue.title: getBurningValue
getburningvalue.description: Returns how much the unit is exposed to fire damage.

getbleedingremaining.title: getBleedingRemaining
getbleedingremaining.description: Returns how many seconds injured unit will continue leaving blood trail. If unit damage is < 0.1, the return value is 0 and unit doesn't leave any blood trail. Use setBleedingRemaining to set different remaining time.

debriefingtext.title: debriefingText
debriefingtext.description: Returns debriefing text of provided end.

returns.desc: end debriefing text. If it does not exist in config, empty string is returned.

getartilleryammo.title: getArtilleryAmmo
getartilleryammo.description: Get list of all available magazines of artillery units on the list. Command returns only unique magazine types and doesn't contain any information about which unit has which magazine.

synchronizedwaypoints.title: synchronizedWaypoints
synchronizedwaypoints.description: Returns the list of waypoints synchronized with a given trigger or waypoint.

synchronizedtriggers.title: synchronizedTriggers
synchronizedtriggers.description: Returns the list of triggers synchronized with a given waypoint.

boundingboxreal.title: boundingBoxReal
boundingboxreal.description:
File:Boundingbox.jpg200 Returns a raw bounding box of given object in model coordinates space. This command is similar to boundingBox but gives more precise measurements.
The alternative syntax allows to specify clipping type to be used, which in some cases could make the result even more precise.

returns.desc: the extreme points of the model in format PositionRelative, as well as (since ) bounding box sphere radius, to format [[xmin, ymin, zmin], [xmax, ymax, zmax], boundingSphereRadius]

args.name:
clippingType: Number - can be one of:
* 0 - ClipVisual (can significantly reduce bounding box's size on buildings)
* 1 - ClipShadow
* 2 - ClipGeometry
* 3 - ClipGeneral (same type that is used in the main syntax)

returns.desc: the extreme points of the model in format PositionRelative, as well as bounding box sphere radius, to format [[xmin, ymin, zmin], [xmax, ymax, zmax], boundingSphereRadius]

args.name:
LOD: String or Number - can be one of:
* `"Memory"`
* `"Geometry"`
* `"FireGeometry"`
* `"LandContact"`
* `"HitPoints"`
* `"ViewGeometry"`
When Number is used, command searches for a LOD with the similar LOD resolution

returns.desc: the extreme points of the model in format PositionRelative, as well as bounding box sphere radius, to format [[xmin, ymin, zmin], [xmax, ymax, zmax], boundingSphereRadius]

weaponlowered.title: weaponLowered
weaponlowered.description: Returns true if given soldier's weapon is lowered.

playsound3d.title: playSound3D
playsound3d.description: Plays positional sound with given filename on every computer on network.

syntaxes.code: playSound3D [filename, soundSource, isInside, soundPosition, volume, soundPitch, distance, offset, local]

args.name: filename
args.desc: see Arma 3: Sound Files for available file names or  to use mission files;  filename can start with a leading slash `\a3\...`

args.name: soundSource
args.desc: the object emitting the sound. If soundPosition below is specified this parameter is ignored

args.name: isInside
args.desc: (Optional, default false) - true to simulate a sound played inside a building or similar

args.name: soundPosition: Array format PositionASL - (Optional, default [0,0,0]) position for sound emitter, overrides soundSource
volume
args.desc: (Optional, default 1) sound volume. A value greater than 5 gets capped

args.name:
soundPitch: Number - (Optional, default 1)
* 1.0 → normal 
* 0.5 → Darth Vader
* 2.0 → Chipmunks
distance
args.desc: (Optional, default 0) how far the sound is audible, in meters. `0` means no maximum distance

args.name: offset
args.desc: (Optional, default 0) offset in seconds. Same as with playMusic

args.name: local
args.desc: (Optional, default false) if true the sound will not be broadcast over network

returns.desc: id of the sound (0..65535) (was Nothing before )

distancesqr.title: distanceSqr
distancesqr.description:
Computes the  between two objects or positions.
This command is faster than  by saving a  operation, useful for mass-checking distance without the need of the distance value itself.

returns.desc: distance in meters or 1e10 if distance cannot be calculated
distance c calculated as  inlinec = a * a + b * b

eyedirection.title: eyeDirection
eyedirection.description: Returns the direction object is watching (eyes, or a vehicle primary observer).

args.name: time
args.desc: transition time in seconds. `0` will cause the change to be immediate

args.name: direction
args.desc: flat wind direction and strength in format Position2D

addmissioneventhandler.title: addMissionEventHandler
addmissioneventhandler.description: Adds event handler attached to the current mission and returns event handler handle. For the list of available mission event handlers see: Arma 3: Mission Event Handlers

args.name:
expression: Code or String - expression that will be executed in missionNamespace when event handler fires.
* If the event handler has some data to return upon activation they are stored in the `_this` variable
*  the event handler's handle is stored in `_thisEventHandler` variable and is available during event handler code execution
*  it is possible to pass additional arguments to the EH code via optional param. The args are stored in `_thisArgs` variable
*  the event's name is available from `_thisEvent` variable
arguments
args.desc: (Optional, default  inline[]) additional arguments to be passed to the EH code. Available during code execution via `_thisArgs` variable.

returns.desc: the index of the currently added mission event handler is returned

removemissioneventhandler.title: removeMissionEventHandler
removemissioneventhandler.description: Removes mission event handler added by addMissionEventHandler.

removeallmissioneventhandlers.title: removeAllMissionEventHandlers
removeallmissioneventhandlers.description: Removes all mission event handlers of the given type which were added by addMissionEventHandler.

animatedoor.title: animateDoor

args.name: instant
args.desc: (Optional, default false) when true and phase is either 0 or 1, door will change phase instantaneously

doorphase.title: doorPhase
doorphase.description: Return animation phase of door on vehicle.

classname.title: className
classname.description: Returns short name of location. For config class name, see configName

getposaslw.title: getPosASLW
getposaslw.description: Returns the object position height above water surface (waves and pond objects included).

setposaslw.title: setPosASLW
setposaslw.description: Sets the object position above sea surface. The pos array uses the PositionASLW format.

drawline3d.title: drawLine3D
drawline3d.description: Draws a line of a given colour between two 3D positions in the current frame. To be used mostly in a "Draw3D" mission event handler.

drawicon3d.title: drawIcon3D
drawicon3d.description:
Draws an icon at the given position in the game world. This command has to be executed every frame. Use the Draw3D Mission Event Handler (which is executed every frame if the user can see the icon).
In order for the results of this command to be visible through a custom camera, enable HUD with cameraEffectEnableHUD.
 inlineshowHUD false will hide the icon drawn by this command.
In order for arrows to appear, the icon texture should exist. The arrow size is proportionate to the icon size.

syntaxes.code: drawIcon3D [texture, color, position, width, height, angle, text, shadow, textSize, font, textAlign, drawSideArrows, offsetX, offsetY]

args.name:
color: 
* Array format Color (RGBA) - icon color
*  Array of two Arrays format Color (RGBA) - Icon and text color
position: Array format PositionAGL - icon position
text
args.desc: (Optional, default "") text label to display next to the icon

args.name:
shadow: (Optional, default 0)
* Number:
** 0: no shadow
** 1: shadow (not used in this context, used in UI context)
** 2: outline
* Boolean:
** true - outline
** false - no shadow
textSize
args.desc: (Optional, default size of system) text size

args.name:
textAlign: String - (Optional, default "center") text alignment, can be one of:
* "left"
* "center"
* "right"
drawSideArrows
args.desc: (Optional, default false) true to draw arrows and the text label at edge of screen when the icon moves off the screen

args.name: offsetX
args.desc: (Optional, default 0) X offset for the icon text

args.name: offsetY
args.desc: (Optional, default 0) Y offset for the icon text

linearconversion.title: linearConversion
linearconversion.description: Converts given value from given "from" range to wanted "to" range. If clipping is set to true, the resulting value is guaranteed to be within "to" range no matter what.

syntaxes.code: linearConversion  [minFrom, maxFrom, value, minTo, maxTo, clip]

args.name: clip
args.desc: (Optional, default false) if true, resulting value cannot leave "to" range

savejoysticks.title: saveJoysticks
savejoysticks.description: Saves joysticks key mappings into the joysticks.cfg file. Engine add these joysticks to the Joystick Scheme mapping dialog in options controls section.

istuthintsenabled.title: isTutHintsEnabled
istuthintsenabled.description: Returns the status of TUTORIAL HINTS setting in UI (OPTIONS >> GAME >> GENERAL >> TUTORIAL HINTS).

addmusiceventhandler.title: addMusicEventHandler
addmusiceventhandler.description:
Adds playMusic event handler. Returns id of the handler or -1 when failed. Like addMissionEventHandler, the music event handler is attached to the mission.
See .

removemusiceventhandler.title: removeMusicEventHandler
removemusiceventhandler.description: Removes specified music track event handler. See .

removeallmusiceventhandlers.title: removeAllMusicEventHandlers
removeallmusiceventhandlers.description: Removes all music track event handlers of given type.

islocalized.title: isLocalized
islocalized.description: Checks whether given stringName is localized.

args.name: stringName
args.desc: string which leads to localisation. Casing does not matter. Since Arma 3 v2.04 a string starting with `"$"` is supported as well

sethudmovementlevels.title: setHUDMovementLevels
sethudmovementlevels.description: Set min/max movement borders displayed in HUD gauges. Use -1 to skip some value.

syntaxes.code: setHUDMovementLevels [minSpeed, maxSpeed, minAlt, maxAlt, minDir, maxDir, targetOrPosition]

setobjectmaterial.title: setObjectMaterial
setobjectmaterial.description: Sets material of object selection. The selection number is defined through the hiddenselection[] = {} array in the vehicle's config (starting with 0).

setobjectviewdistance.title: setObjectViewDistance
setobjectviewdistance.description: Sets the rendering distance of objects and shadows.

setrandomlip.title: setRandomLip
setrandomlip.description: Enables/Disables random lip. When enabled, the unit continuously moves its lips as if it is talking.

setsystemofunits.title: setSystemOfUnits
setsystemofunits.description: Set system of units. This will only impact gauges from advanced flight model.

args.name:
value: Number - possible values are:
* 0 - metric
* 1 - mixed
* 2 - imperial

setlocalwindparams.title: setLocalWindParams
setlocalwindparams.description:
Sets parameters for helicopter rotor wash.
It affects the visual effect of a rotor's downwash, such as blown particles, vegetation wind effect and area size.

setaperturenew.title: setApertureNew
setaperturenew.description: Sets custom camera aperture when HDR is enabled. Provided values should be set such as minimum <e; standard <e; maximum.

sethorizonparallaxcoef.title: setHorizonParallaxCoef
sethorizonparallaxcoef.description: Sets coef used to shift horizon position based on camera height (use 0 to disable shifting).

setwindforce.title: setWindForce
setwindforce.description: Set max. wind overall wind changes in time. A time of zero means there will be an immediate change. A wind level of zero is minimal changes and a wind level of one means that wind can change rapidly.

ctrlchecked.title: ctrlChecked
ctrlchecked.description: Returns the current state of given CT_CHECKBOXES control. Since Arma 3 v1.72 it is possible to query multiple checkboxes by providing checkbox index. For more information see CT_CHECKBOXES.

args.name: control
args.desc: CT_CHECKBOXES control. If control contain multiple checkboxes, only checkbox with index 0 is queried.

ctrlhtmlloaded.title: ctrlHTMLLoaded
ctrlhtmlloaded.description: Returns true when HTML content was successfully loaded.

ctrlsetchecked.title: ctrlSetChecked
ctrlsetchecked.description: Sets checked state of a CT_CHECKBOXES control.

args.name: control
args.desc: CT_CHECKBOXES control. If control contain multiple checkboxes, only checkbox with index 0 is queried.

args.name: checked
args.desc: true to check, false to uncheck the checkbox

args.name: checked
args.desc: true to check, false to uncheck the checkbox

ctrltextheight.title: ctrlTextHeight
ctrltextheight.description:
Returns the control text height. Supported control types are:
* CT_STATIC
* CT_STRUCTURED_TEXT
* CT_EDIT 
Since Arma 3 v2.05.147765 control types added:
* CT_XKEYDESC
* CT_XBUTTON
* CT_SHORTCUTBUTTON
* CT_BUTTON
* CT_ACTIVETEXT

ctrlsetfontp.title: ctrlSetFontP
ctrlsetfontp.description: Sets P font of given HTML control or its size.

simulweathersync.title: simulWeatherSync
simulweathersync.description: Synchronizes Simul Weather with Arma weather, generates all keyframes.

nearsupplies.title: nearSupplies
nearsupplies.description: Find supplies (weapon holders, ammo crates, fuel feeds, other units) in the sphere with given radius.

args.name: origin: Object or Array in format PositionAGL or Position2D
origin: Object or Array in format PositionAGL or Position2D

removeallactions.title: removeAllActions
removeallactions.description: Removes all unit's user added actions.

setcompassoscillation.title: setCompassOscillation
setcompassoscillation.description: This command sets random heading on the player's compass (both in map and in 3D view) with given frequency, which is also randomised.

args.name: angle
args.desc: heading deviation angle in radians; the random angle will be picked up from `[-angle...+angle]` range

args.name: frequencyMin
args.desc: lower bound of heading change in seconds

args.name: frequencyMax
args.desc: higher bound of heading change in seconds

getdescription.title: getDescription
getdescription.description: Returns the string representation of unit as an four slots array.

sendaumessage.title: sendAUMessage
sendaumessage.description: Send the command to the list of clients.

difficulty.title: difficulty
difficulty.description:
Returns high-level selected difficulty mode.   

Returned value will be: 0 (Recruit), 1 (Regular), 2 (Veteran) or 3 (Elite)

getartilleryeta.title: getArtilleryETA
getartilleryeta.description: Returns ETA to the target in seconds for given artillery unit based on target position and used magazine, -1 if target can't be hit.

args.name: targetPosition
args.desc: position of the target in format PositionAGLS (getPos, position)

getfuelcargo.title: getFuelCargo
getfuelcargo.description: Returns the fuel amount (1 is full) in the cargo space of a refueling vehicle.

returns.desc: fuel cargo value, -1 if fuel cargo is not supported, 0 if the vehicle is !alive or isNull

getammocargo.title: getAmmoCargo
getammocargo.description: Returns the amount (1 is full) of ammo resources in the cargo space of a rearm vehicle.

returns.desc: ammo cargo value, -1 if ammo cargo is not supported, 0 if the vehicle is !alive or isNull

getrepaircargo.title: getRepairCargo
getrepaircargo.description: Returns the amount (1 is full) of repair resources in the cargo space of a repair vehicle.

returns.desc: repair cargo value, -1 if repair cargo is not supported, 0 if the vehicle is !alive or isNull

units.title: units
units.description: Returns an array with all the units in the group or unit's group, or all units belonging to a certain side.

lbsettooltip.title: lbSetTooltip
lbsettooltip.description: Sets tooltip for item with given index of the listbox or combobox with id idc of the topmost user dialog to the given data.

canadd.title: canAdd
canadd.description:
Checks if given object can be stored in inventory of given object or any inventory container (uniform, vest, backpack) of given unit.
Before  v2.10 this comment verified only the biggest container when multiple items were queried; now it checks all containers.

args.name: ignoreSoldierMaxLoad
args.desc: (Optional, default false) true to ignore 'soldierMaxLoad' param, container's maxLoad is still counted

args.name: item
args.desc: config class of magazine or attachment

args.name: slot
args.desc: slot class name (defined under WeaponSlotsInfo class in weapon config)

removeallprimaryweaponitems.title: removeAllPrimaryWeaponItems
removeallprimaryweaponitems.description: Removes all items from primaryWeapon, except magazine.

removehandgunitem.title: removeHandgunItem
removehandgunitem.description: Removes given weapon item, including magazine, from the handgunWeapon

removeallhandgunitems.title: removeAllHandgunItems
removeallhandgunitems.description: Removes all items from handgunWeapon, except magazine.

primaryweaponmagazine.title: primaryWeaponMagazine
primaryweaponmagazine.description: Collects all loaded magazines from all primaryWeapon muzzles and returns them in Array, otherwise it returns []. This command is used for infantry weapons only.

secondaryweaponmagazine.title: secondaryWeaponMagazine
secondaryweaponmagazine.description: Collects all loaded magazines from all secondaryWeapon muzzles and returns them in Array, otherwise it returns []. This command is used for infantry weapons only.

handgunmagazine.title: handgunMagazine
handgunmagazine.description: Collects all loaded magazines from all handgunWeapon muzzles and returns them in Array, otherwise it returns []. This command is used for infantry weapons only.

removeprimaryweaponitem.title: removePrimaryWeaponItem
removeprimaryweaponitem.description: Removes given weapon item, including magazine, from the primaryWeapon.

isstreamfriendlyuienabled.title: isStreamFriendlyUIEnabled
