rainparams.description: Returns currently set  RainParticles params, custom or default.

returns.desc: [rainDropTexture, texDropCount, minRainDensity, effectRadius, windCoef, dropSpeed, rndSpeed, rndDir, dropWidth, dropHeight, dropColor, lumSunFront, lumSunBack, refractCoef, refractSaturation, snow, dropColorStrong] where:

sethumidity.title: setHumidity
sethumidity.description: Sets surface humidity. Affects how footsteps sound (dry / wet). humidity is increasing when raining and decreasing when not raining. Exception is if the rain is set with 'snow' flag, then humidity is not updated.

awake.title: awake
awake.description: Wakes up sleeping PhysX object or puts a PhysX object to sleep. In 2.10 this command can be used on corpses of type `Man` and has no effect on alive units. When unit gets killed it goes into ragdoll state for a short while, then the units get frozen and any simulation and collision is removed to save system resources. As a result, corpses do not react to their surrounding any more. Using this command will temporarily re-enable ragdoll state of a corpse to the same state it was when unit died. If this command is used in "enable/disable" sequence on a dead body, it gives the corpse a visible nudge (See example 3).

args.name: awake
args.desc: true to awake the object, false - to put it to sleep

isawake.title: isAwake
isawake.description:
Returns resting state of a PhysX (EPE) object. Some EPE objects are deliberately put to sleep by the engine to save resources. This command returns true when object is simulating and false when it is put to sleep. With units of type `Man` the behaviour is slightly different. As units never get put to sleep, the command outputs ragdoll state of a unit instead. There are 6 states for the output of the command:
* EPE object is simulaing - true
* EPE object is put to sleep - false
* Unit is alive, ragdoll is active - false
* Unit is alive, ragdoll is NOT active - true
*  Unit is NOT alive, ragdoll is active - true
*  Unit is NOT alive, ragdoll is NOT active - false
It may look counter-intuitive but there is a simple formula to return ragdoll state of a unit (since ):
private _unitIsInRagdoll = alive _unit != isAwake _unit;

issaving.title: isSaving
issaving.description: Returns the status of autosave request, made when saveGame command is executed. When request is made, the command immediately returns true. The engine then handles the saving and when it is done, the command returns false.

returns.desc: true autosave request is made, false autosave request is processed

isallowedcrewinimmobile.title: isAllowedCrewInImmobile
isallowedcrewinimmobile.description: Whether or not units can be in a vehicle with broken tracks/wheels.

collisiondisabledwith.title: collisionDisabledWith
collisiondisabledwith.description: Returns the object, given object has collision disabled with and whether or not returned object has also collision disabled with given object.

inputcontroller.title: inputController
inputcontroller.description: Returns the state of controller inputs. The controller is a standard XBOX controller which is selected with Windows XBOX controller scheme. The input can be:

args.name: input
args.desc: controller input 0...31 (see description) or -1 for controller detection.

returns.desc: value of the controller input 0...1. When input is -1, return is 1 if controller is available, 0 - if controller is unavailable

inputmouse.title: inputMouse
inputmouse.description:
Returns the state of mouse button action, alone or in combination with key presses. For more information on codes and combos see Arma_3:_Modded_Keybinding and DIK_KeyCodes but here are some examples of how codes could be hand constructed:

* KEYBOARD_COMBO 16777216 (0x1000000)
* DEVICE_MOUSE 65536 (0x10000)
* HOLD_OFFSET 0
* CLICK_OFFSET 128 (0x80)
* DOUBLE_CLICK_OFFSET 256 (0x100)
* SPECIAL_COMBINATIONS 1114112 (0x110000)

Click + Hold: BUTTON + DEVICE_MOUSE + HOLD_OFFSET = BUTTON + 65536 + 0
Click: BUTTON + DEVICE_MOUSE + CLICK_OFFSET = BUTTON + 65536 + 128 
Double Click: BUTTON + DEVICE_MOUSE + DOUBLE_CLICK_OFFSET = BUTTON + 65536 + 256

RMB Click + Hold:  1 + 65536 + 0 = 65537
RMB Click: 1 + 65536 + 128 = 65665
RMB Double Click: 1 + 65536 + 256 = 65793

Combo + Click + Hold: DIK * KEYBOARD_COMBO + SPECIAL_COMBINATIONS + BUTTON + HOLD_OFFSET = DIK * 16777216 + 1114112 + BUTTON + 0
Combo + Click: DIK * KEYBOARD_COMBO + SPECIAL_COMBINATIONS + BUTTON + CLICK_OFFSET = DIK * 16777216 + 1114112 + BUTTON + 128
Combo + Double Click: DIK * KEYBOARD_COMBO + SPECIAL_COMBINATIONS + BUTTON + DOUBLE_CLICK_OFFSET = DIK * 16777216 + 1114112 + BUTTON + 256

LShift + RMB Click + Hold: 42 * 16777216 + 1114112 + 1 + 0 = 705757185
LShift + RMB Click: 42 * 16777216 + 1114112 + 1 + 128 = 705757313
LShift + RMB Double Click: 42 * 16777216 + 1114112 + 1 + 256 = 705757441

returns.desc: true if given code/combination detected, false otherwise

pose.title: pose
pose.description: Returns the pose of the given unit.

disablebrakes.title: disableBrakes
disablebrakes.description: Disables autobrake, which is engaged when vehicle is stationary and stops wheels from rotating freely when vehicle is pushed.

args.name: disable

brakesdisabled.title: brakesDisabled
brakesdisabled.description: Returns the status of autobrake (see disableBrakes).

args.desc: min freefall height, -1 to set default

findany.title: findAny
findany.description:
Returns the zero-based index of the first element in array A that also exists in array B. If no common elements exist it returns -1.
Similar in functionality as find's first syntax, but the second parameter is an array of elements to find.

returns.desc: the index of the first found item

loadconfig.title: loadConfig
loadconfig.description: Loads the given file as a Config, allowing easy processing of the config file contents using commands such as configClasses, configProperties, >>, etc. It can load .rvmat, .bisurf, .cpp, .bin, .sqm, and description.ext files (both binarized and unbinarized configs are supported).

args.name: path
args.desc: path to the file, which should be in a valid config format.

returns.desc: loaded config. Returns configNull if the file doesn't exist.

missionprofilenamespace.title: missionProfileNamespace
missionprofilenamespace.description: This namespace has the same lifetime as profileNamespace but is also connected to the mission it is saved from. See saveMissionProfileNamespace for more details.

savemissionprofilenamespace.title: saveMissionProfileNamespace
savemissionprofilenamespace.description:
missionProfileNamespace provides long term storage solution for mission variables. When this namespace has variables set with setVariable and is saved, the variables are saved into `missionName.vars` file into current soldier profileName folder. Next time when the same mission is loaded by the client with the same soldier profile, the saved variables can be read normally with getVariable command. This way each mission maker can create persistent data that is both mission and soldier profile specific. This is default behaviour. The file is only created when save operation is invoked with this command.
It is also possible to share the same mission profile variables between several missions. To override default behaviour one needs to create an entry `1 missionGroup` in  Description.ext, for example `1 missionGroup = "MyMissionCollectionName";`. This will create `MyMissionCollectionName.vars` file instead of default one, which would be loaded into every mission with matching `missionGroup` entry.

ismissionprofilenamespaceloaded.title: isMissionProfileNamespaceLoaded
ismissionprofilenamespaceloaded.description: The missionProfileNamespace variables are loaded at the start of a mission, before 'init.sqf' is executed. If the file with saved variables for current mission exists in user profile and is loaded, the command returns true. It also will return true after the first execution of saveMissionProfileNamespace command, which also creates the file.

returns.desc: true if mission profile variables file exists and is loaded.

getopticsmode.title: getOpticsMode
getopticsmode.description: Returns the class name of the current optic mode of the current weapon.

args.name:
slot: Number - can be one of:
* 0 - Current weapon
* 1 - Primary weapon
* 2 - Secondary weapon
* 3 - Handgun

returns.desc: class name of the current optic mode of the current weapon

setopticsmode.title: setOpticsMode
setopticsmode.description: Sets the optic mode of the current weapon to the given class name or the index.

args.name:
mode: String, Number or Array:
* String - class name defined in the optic's `OpticsModes` config class
* Number - 0-based index of the optic mode with 0 being the default optic mode
* Array - in format [slotIndex, opticsModeIndexOrClassName] where:
** slotIndex: Number, can be one of:
*** 0 - Current weapon
*** 1 - Primary weapon
*** 2 - Secondary weapon
*** 3 - Handgun
** opticsModeIndexOrClassName: String or Number as above

actionkeysex.title: actionKeysEx
actionkeysex.description:
Gives a broken down version of actionKeys return. Returns an Array containing the breakdowns of the dikCodes of keys, buttons and combos assigned to the given user action.
Action names can be found in config class ControllerSchemes or user action names or user profile (see ).
In addition, some of the actions are also listed here: inputAction/actions

The Key Device can be one of several types:

weaponsinfo.title: weaponsInfo
weaponsinfo.description: Returns entity's weapons information including weapon index and firemode.

args.name: weaponOrMuzzle
args.desc: name of the weapon or muzzle (returns whichever matches first) or "" to return all weapons

args.name: onlyLoaded
args.desc: (Optional, default false) true to return loaded weapons only

activetitleeffectparams.title: activeTitleEffectParams
activetitleeffectparams.description: Returns type, effect, speed and map visibility of the given active title effect (see allActiveTitleEffects)

nearestmines.title: nearestMines
nearestmines.description:
Returns a list of nearest mines of the given types to the given position or object, within the specified distance.
If more than one mine are found they will be ordered by proximity by default, the closest one will be first in the array. The sorting can be turned off.

args.name: position:  Object or Array in format PositionAGL or Position2D - search position centre
types
args.desc: list of class name of the objects to search for (uses isKindOf comparison instead of direct class name == comparison). Use an empty array  inline[] to search for all classes

args.name: sort
args.desc: (Optional, default true) true to sort the results closest first, false to turn off sorting

args.name: 2Dmode
args.desc: (Optional, default false) true for 2D distance, false for 3D distance comparison

returns.desc: found mines as array of Objects

compatibleitems.title: compatibleItems
compatibleitems.description: Returns all items (attachments) that can be mounted on the given weapon.

args.name: slot
args.desc: class name of the slot (defined under WeaponSlotsInfo class in weapon config)

compatiblemagazines.title: compatibleMagazines
compatiblemagazines.description: Returns all magazines that can be loaded in the given weapon.

allobjects.title: allObjects
allobjects.description: Returns array of requested objects as fast as the engine allows it. The objects can be requested by object type and simulation kind.

args.name:
objectType: Number - type can be a combination of types according to bit flag operation (see getObjectType):
* -1 -  All types incl. nulls (nulls exist with 'objectCollection' 7 and 8)
* 1 - Primary - normal object placed in Terrain Builder, part of landscape
* 2 - Network - road placed in Terrain Builder, part of landscape
* 4 - Temporary - temporary object (like vehicle tracks)
* 8 - TypeVehicle - entity added by game
* 16 - TypeTempVehicle - temporary entity
* 32 - LandDecal - land decal
For example if required objects are both TerrainBuilder-placed (1) and dynamically placed (8) the combination type will be  8 + 1 = 9

objectCollection: Number - supported values:
* 0 - Slow (and very slow) entities: some houses, rubbles, street lamps, churches, etc
* 1 - Normal entities: vehicles etc
* 2 - Fast entities: shots and other high precision entities
* 3 - Cloudlets: smokes, dust, etc
* 4 - Out vehicles: objects that are not listed anywhere else, holders, etc
* 5 - Animals: animals, birds, insects, etc
* 6 - Mines: mines
* 7 -  Sensor map: ordered triggers. When trigger is created it is added to this collection in the order of creation. When deleted it becomes null. Use 'objectType' -1 to include nulls
* 8 -  Vehicle map: ordered vehicles. When vehicle is created it is added to this collection in the order of creation. When deleted it becomes null. Use 'objectType' -1 to include nulls
* 9 -  Vehicles and crew: normal entities as in 1 as well as crew if an entity is a vehcile with crew.
objectType
args.desc: type of the objects (will exact match return of typeOf)

playsoundui.title: playSoundUI
playsoundui.description: Plays given CfgSounds sound or a  sound file given by file path through a dedicated UI sound channel unaffected by the global mixer volumes. If the file path is given, the leading slash will be ignored.

args.name: sound
args.desc: CfgSounds class or file as used in playSound3D (see Arma 3: Sound Files for available file names)

args.name: volume
args.desc: (Optional, default 1) sound volume clamped in range 0..5

args.name:
soundPitch: Number - (Optional, default 1)
* 1.0 → normal 
* 0.5 → Darth Vader
* 2.0 → Chipmunks
isEffect
args.desc: (Optional, default false) if true, diverts sound through effects channel (see fadeSound, soundVolume)

args.name: offset
args.desc: (Optional, default 0) offset in seconds. Same as with playSound3D

returns.desc: id of the sound (0..65535) since  (was Nothing before that)

inarea.title: inArea
inarea.description: Checks whether given position or object is inside given area. Use inAreaArray to check multiple positions/objects within area.

args.name: position: Object or Array in format Position2D or Position3D (must be PositionAGL if area is checked in 3D)

area: Object, String, Location
* Object - trigger
* String - marker name
* Location - location

syntaxes.code: position inArea [center, a, b, angle, isRectangle, c]

args.name: position: Object or Array in format Position2D or Position3D (must be PositionAGL if area is checked in 3D)
center: Array or Object - center of the area in format Position2D, Position3D (must be PositionAGL if area is checked in 3D), Object or Group
isRectangle
args.desc: true if rectangle, false if ellipse

inareaarray.title: inAreaArray
inareaarray.description: Returns given list of Objects and/or Positions that are in the given area, area defined by a trigger, marker, location or array.

args.name: positions: Array of Objects and/or Positions

area: Object, Location or String - the defined area:
* Object - trigger
* Location - location
* String - marker name

syntaxes.code: positions inAreaArray  [center, a, b, angle, isRectangle, c]

args.name: positions
args.desc: Objects and/or Positions to check. Positions must be PositionAGL if area is checked in 3D

args.name: center: Array format Position2D or PositionAGL,  Object or Group
isRectangle
args.desc: (Optional, default false) true if rectangle, false if ellipse

entities.title: entities
entities.description: Returns a list of all alive and dead entities of the given type or deriving from the given type. Units in vehicles are ignored with the primary syntax.

args.name: type
args.desc: if an empty string `""` is provided, all entities are returned

args.name: typesInclude
args.desc: in format [type1, type2, ...typeN], where type is a String. Empty array [] means include every entity. Method used for filtering - isKindOf

args.name: typesExclude
args.desc: in format [type1, type2, ...typeN], where type is a String. Empty array [] means exclude no entity. Method used for filtering - isKindOf

args.name: includeCrews
args.desc: (Optional, default false) include crews currently in vehicles

in.title: in
in.description: Checks whether value is in array, unit is in vehicle, position is inside location or ANSI string is part of other ANSI string. If Unicode support is desired, see forceUnicode.

nearestterrainobjects.title: nearestTerrainObjects
nearestterrainobjects.description:
Returns a list of nearest terrain objects of the given types to the given position or object, within the specified distance. If more than one object is found they will be ordered according to 3D distance to the object (i.e. the closest one will be first in the array). 
In contrast to nearestObjects this command returns terrain placed objects like trees, rocks and buildings which don't necessarily need an associated config class.
Possible type names:




<spoiler text="Terrain object counts">

Stratis


Altis


Malden 2035


Tanoa


Livonia


Weferlingen


Weferlingen (Winter)


Cam Lao Nam


Khe Sanh


The Bra


Gabreta


Sefrou-Ramal


Spearhead 1944 Normandy



</spoiler>

args.name: position: Object, PositionAGL or Position2D - where to find objects, center position
types
args.desc: list of case-insensitive types of the objects to search for. `[]` to search without filters

args.name: radius
args.desc: range from center position to search for objects

args.name: sort
args.desc: (Optional, default true) sort objects by distance to the center or not - setting to false greatly improves performance

args.name: 2Dmode
args.desc: (Optional, default false) the object search and sorting mode: true - 2D, false - 3D

returns.desc: array of terrain objects. Before  v2.00 this command did not return roads of type `"ROAD", "MAIN ROAD", "TRACK", "TRAIL"`

nearestobjects.title: nearestObjects
nearestobjects.description:
Returns a list of nearest objects of the given types to the given position or object, within the specified distance. If more than one object is found they will be ordered by proximity, the closest one will be first in the array. If an object is given as the center and the filter criteria applies to it, it will be the first result in the list. Alternatively, you can use nearObjects command, which doesn't sort results.

A list of ClassName types (e.g `Tank`) can be found in CfgVehicles.

args.name: position:  Object or Array in format PositionAGL or Position2D - where to find objects, center position.
types
args.desc: list of class name of the objects to search for. Use an empty array  inline[] to search for all classes.

args.name: radius
args.desc: range from center position to search for objects.

args.name: 2Dmode
args.desc: (Optional, default false) true for 2D distance, false for 3D distance

lnbsettextright.title: lnbSetTextRight
lnbsettextright.description: Sets cell's right-aligned text. Does not replace cell's text.

args.name: row
args.desc: 0-based index (first row is 0, second is 1, etc)

args.name: column
args.desc: 0-based index (first column is 0, second is 1, etc)

args.name: row
args.desc: 0-based index (first row is 0, second is 1, etc)

args.name: column
args.desc: 0-based index (first column is 0, second is 1, etc)

lnbsetdata.title: lnbSetData

lnbsetvalue.title: lnbSetValue

waypointattachobject.title: waypointAttachObject

The turret has to be manned. One can also change the magazine if its respective weapon is not selected.

args.desc: transition time, 0 for instant center of mass transfer

args.name:
properties: Array in format [color, text, scale, visibility, WPvisibility WPcolor], where:

* visibility: Boolean - icon visibility

setvehicleposition.title: setVehiclePosition
setvehicleposition.description:
Moves the object to a given position (same as createVehicle placement algorithm). Uses either the position that's defined by the position param, or one of the marker positions from the markers array. The object is placed inside a circle with position as its center and placement as its radius. The type of placement could also be controlled with special.
If position is in water and the vehicle can float, it is placed on water surface, otherwise it is placed on the ground, even if the ground is under water. If roof surfaces support walking, units will be placed on roofs if such position is given.

args.name:
position: Array format PositionATL (PositionAGL if boat or amphibious), Position2D, or Object - desired placement position.
If object is given, object position is used for position. Normally only x and y are considered, unless "CAN_COLLIDE" is used for special placement

markers: Array of Strings - if the markers array contains one or more marker names, the position is chosen randomly and could be one of the marker positions or just the supplied main position.
If marker had z coordinate set with setMarkerPos, the vehicle will be placed on the nearest surface below this z coordinate
placement
args.desc: the vehicle is randomly placed inside a circle with given position as center and placement as its radius

args.name:
special: String - (Optional, default "NONE") can be one of the following: 
* `"NONE"` - will look for suitable empty position near given position (subject to other placement params) before placing vehicle there. 
* `"CAN_COLLIDE"` - places vehicle at given position (subject to other placement params), without checking if others objects can cross its 3D model. 
* `"FLY"` - if vehicle is capable of flying and has crew, it will be made airborne at default height. 
If special is "" or not specified, default `"NONE"` is used.

returns.desc: true on success, false on failure

createhashmapobject.title: createHashMapObject
createhashmapobject.description:
Create a HashMap with an  behaviour.
Inside a object, Methods (if they are called correctly, either by engine or via ) will have the objects instance inside the  inline_self variable.
The Destructor ("#delete" method) will be executed when the last reference to the objects variable gets deleted. (Except when the mission is ended and all variables are deleted at once)

Inheritance: HashMap objects support a simple form of Inheritance.
It behaves similar to the merge command with overwriteExisting enabled. Sub-class methods and properties with same name, overwrite their Base-class values.
Constructor/Destructor/Clone methods will be merged together and executed in sequence.
Flags entry will use overwrite behaviour.

args.name:
classDefinition: HashMap or Array of Arrays, format [name, value]:
name can be anything like any other HashMap, but it must be a String for it to be used like an OOP object method (see ).
Some special values, starting with `#`, are reserved and expect a specific value type (they are all optional):
* `"#create"`: Code - this is the hashmap object's constructor
* `"#clone"`: Code - this is code happening when cloning is done on this hashmap object
* `"#delete"`: Code - this is the hashmap object's destructor. It will always be executed inside missionNamespace.
* `"#str"`: Code - code that is used to evaluate what is displayed when the str function is called on the object - must return String
* `"#flags"`: Array of Strings - case-insensitive flags regarding this hashmap object
** "noCopy": forbids copying,  inline+_hashMapObject will throw an error
** "sealed": prevents from adding and removing any keys - key values can still be edited
** "unscheduled": all methods (including `#clone` and `#create`) will be executed in 
* `"#base"`: Array or HashMap - declaration of base class for inheritance
* `"#type"`: Any - can be used to give a object a "type name", on inheritance types will be merged into an Array
Note that all entries beginning with `#` are reserved, the engine might use these internally without their use being documented.
constructorArguments
args.desc: (Optional, default Nothing) passed as  inline_this argument to the "#create" method.

privateall.title: privateAll
privateall.description:
Disables the implicit inheritance of local variables, as defined in the parent scope.
By default, any local variables defined in a parent scope are available to the lower scope code.
After using privateAll, parent scope variables can no longer be accessed implicitly. However, it is still possible to explicitly access parent scope variables using the import command.

import.title: import
import.description: Imports one or multiple local variables from the parent scope, and defines them as private variables in the current scope. It can bypass privateAll.

args.name: variableName: String or Array of Strings - variable(s) to import

* "PUT"

sendcloudrequestserver.title: sendCloudRequestServer
sendcloudrequestserver.description: Sends a server request to the  cloud service and executes callback code with server's response.

args.name: callback
args.desc: (Optional, default "") code to be executed on request completion

args.name: data
args.desc: (Optional, default "") JSON data to be sent

args.name:
httpMethod: String - (Optional, default "GET", or "POST" if data is provided - case-insensitive) can be one of:
* "POST"
* "GET"
* "DELETE"
* "PUT"

serverconfigtoplevelentry.title: serverConfigTopLevelEntry
serverconfigtoplevelentry.description: Get top-level entry (i.e. entry directly below config root) of the desired name from the , making it some kind of secured serverConfigFile command.

args.name: configEntry
args.desc: any server.cfg entry but `password` and `passwordAdmin` which are ignored

returns.desc: requested server config entry or configNull on error

serverstartmission.title: serverStartMission
serverstartmission.description: Start the provided mission (if it exists) on a dedicated server.

returns.desc: true if the mission could be started on a dedicated server, false otherwise

getleaning.title: getLeaning
getleaning.description: Returns the leaning factor of the given unit.

forcehitpointsdamagesync.title: forceHitPointsDamageSync
forcehitpointsdamagesync.description:
Synchronises hitpoints values and total damage across current network clients as well as JIP.
Possible uses after executing script commands such as setHit, setHitIndex, setHitPointDamage or in conjunction with  event handler (see ).
To sync static buildings, execute on the server.

getentityinfo.title: getEntityInfo
getentityinfo.description: Returns various properties for the given entity.

args.name: index
args.desc: property index (see main syntax, 2 - isDeadSet for example)

returns.desc: depends on the requested property, or Nothing

actionnow.title: actionNow
actionnow.description: Make a unit perform an action immediately (without any animation/pre-processing). See the action command for more information.

diag_resetanims.title: diag_resetAnims
diag_resetanims.description: Resets the animations system cache, so that animation makers can test their animations without restarting the game. A mission restart is required for the changes to be applied.

setcompassdeclination.title: setCompassDeclination
setcompassdeclination.description: Sets the  of player's compass, which is the difference between magnetic north and true north.

args.name: angleRad
args.desc: Declination angle in radians. Use 0 to reset it to default.

setmissionoptions.title: setMissionOptions
setmissionoptions.description:
Sets various mission options. The options are automatically reset between missions and are saved/restored with the save system.

Providing an empty array will reset all options to defaults.

args.name: ignoreNoDamage
args.desc: (default false) true to filter out no change in damage from  calls

args.name: ignoreFakeHeadHit
args.desc: (default false) true to filter out FakeHeadHit context from  calls

getbonenames.title: getBoneNames
getbonenames.description: Returns an array of bone names and their parents.

getselectionbones.title: getSelectionBones
getselectionbones.description: Returns an array of bone names that are attached to the specified selection.

args.name:
LOD: String or Number - can be one of:

When Number is used, command searches for a LOD with the same LOD resolution

ignoretarget.title: ignoreTarget
ignoretarget.description: Sets a target to be ignored by this Group. It will not appear in nearTargets and the group will not notice its presence. targetKnowledge can be used to check if a target is currently ignored. While a unit is ignored, reveal has no effect.

args.name: group : Object or Group - which receives revealing information
group : Object or Group - which receives revealing information
isIgnored
args.desc: whether the target should be ignored

diag_sqfcdebugdump.title: diag_SQFCDebugDump
diag_sqfcdebugdump.description: Dumps the bytecode as  sees it, in a diff friendly way. Useful for testing custom SQFC compilers.

args.name: sourcePath
args.desc: Path to file on drive that should be read

args.name: targetPath
args.desc: Path to file on drive to output to

getshotinfo.title: getShotInfo
getshotinfo.description: Returns various properties for the given shot.

args.name: index
args.desc: property index (see main syntax, for example 1 for fuseDistanceLeft)

returns.desc: depends on the requested property, or Nothing
